entry.title: Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA)å…¥é–€
entry.content:
GSEAã¨ã¯

GSEAã¯ç™ºç¾å·®ç•°è§£æã®çµæœãªã©ã§å¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹éºä¼å­ç¾¤ãŒã©ã†ã„ã£ãŸæ©Ÿèƒ½ã®ã‚‚ã®ã‹ã‚’æ˜ã‚‰ã‹ã«ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã«ç”¨ã„ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹è§£ææ‰‹æ³•ã§ã™ã€‚æ©Ÿèƒ½è¡¨ç¾ã¨ã—ã¦ç”¨ã„ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ä¸»ãªã‚‚ã®ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯KEGGã®ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¤åˆ†é¡ã‚„Gene Ontology(GO)ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

clusterProfilerã§GSEAå…¥é–€

GSEA ã«ã¯æ§˜ã€…ãªGSEAãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚å˜ã«æ³¨ç›®ã™ã‚‹éºä¼å­ã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’GSEAã¸ã®å…¥åŠ›ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã€ç™ºç¾ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’å…¥åŠ›ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã€æ©Ÿèƒ½ã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚„GSEAæ‰‹æ³•ã‚’è¤‡æ•°çµ„ã¿åˆã‚ã›ãŸã‚Šã™ã‚‹ã‚‚ã® (EGSEA) ãªã©æ§˜ã€…ã§ã™ã€‚[ä½™è«‡ã§ã™ãŒGeneã‚’ä»£è¬ç‰©(Metabolite)ã«ç½®ãæ›ãˆãŸMSEAã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚]

ã“ã“ã§ã¯å‰è¿°ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®ã®å†…ã€æœ€åˆã®ã€Œå˜ã«æ³¨ç›®ã™ã‚‹éºä¼å­ã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’GSEAã¸ã®å…¥åŠ›ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã€ã‚’bioconductorã®ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ clusterProfiler ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦ä½“é¨“ã—ã¦ã¿ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚

entry.title: AtCoder Beginners Selection é›‘æ„Ÿ
entry.content:
ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°åˆå¿ƒè€…ã®åŠ è—¤ã§ã™ã€‚å‹‰å¼·ä¼šã®æ™‚ã«ã€ã¨ã‚Šã‚ãˆãšã‚„ã£ã¦ã¿ãŸã‚‰ã„ã„ã‚ˆã¨è¨€ã‚ã‚ŒãŸã®ã§ã€ã‚ˆãåˆ†ã‹ã‚‰ãªã„ã¾ã¾ã‚„ã£ã¦ã¿ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ãã®æ¦‚è¦ã¨é›‘æ„Ÿã§ã™ã€‚

AtCoderã¨ã¯ï¼Ÿ

ã¾ãšå§‹ã‚ã«AtCoderã®èª¬æ˜ã‹ã‚‰ã€‚AtCoderã¨ã¯ã€ã‚ªãƒ³ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³ä¸Šã§ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã®ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’æä¾›ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã®ã“ã¨ã§ã™(https://atcoder.jp/?lang=ja)ã€‚

å®šæœŸçš„ã«ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’ä¸»å‚¬ã—ã¦ã„ãŸã‚Šã€ä¼æ¥­ã‹ã‚‰(åºƒå‘Šã‚„äººæç²å¾—æˆ¦ç•¥ã®ä¸€ç’°ã¨ã—ã¦) ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆãŒé–‹ã‹ã‚Œã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã«å‚åŠ ã™ã‚‹ä»¥å¤–ã«ã‚‚ã€ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã§ä½¿ç”¨ã•ã‚ŒãŸå•é¡Œã‚’è§£ãã“ã¨ã‚‚ã§ãã€åˆå¿ƒè€…ã§ã‚‚ã€ã€Œãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°å‹‰å¼·ã—ãŸã„ã‘ã©æœ¬ã‚’ãªãã‚‹ã ã‘ã˜ã‚ƒã¤ã¾ã‚‰ãªã„ï¼ã€ã£ã¦ã„ã†åƒ•ã¿ãŸã„ãªã‚ãŒã¾ã¾ãªäººã«ã¯ã¡ã‚‡ã†ã©ã„ã„ãƒ¢ãƒãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã«ãªã‚‹ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

AtCoder Beginners Selectionã‚’è§£ã“ã†ï¼

ãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒªã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚’èª­ã‚€ã¨ã€ã€Œä½•ã‚’ã™ã‚Œã°è‰¯ã„ã‹åˆ†ã‹ã‚‰ãªã„äººã¯ã€AtCoder Beginners Selectionã‹ã‚‰ã€ã¾ãšã„ãã¤ã‹ã®å•é¡Œã‚’è§£ã„ã¦ã¿ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚ã€ã¨æ›¸ã„ã¦ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã«é£›ã‚“ã§ã¿ã‚‹ã¨ã€ã•ã‚‰ã«ã€ã€Œã“ã®ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã¯ã€ã€AtCoderã«ç™»éŒ²ã—ãŸã‘ã©ä½•ã‚’ã—ã¦ã„ã„ã‹åˆ†ã‹ã‚‰ãªã„ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ»ï¼ã€ã¨ã„ã†äººã«å‘ã‘ã¦ä½œã‚‰ã‚ŒãŸåˆå¿ƒè€…å‘ã‘å•é¡Œé›†ã§ã™ã€‚ã€ã¨ã‚‚æ›¸ã„ã¦ã¾ã™ã€‚

ä½•ã‚‚åˆ†ã‹ã£ã¦ãªã„å­ç¾Šã¡ã‚ƒã‚“ã¯ç´ ç›´ã«å„ªã—ã„è¨€è‘‰ã«ä»˜ã„ã¦è¡Œãã®ã§ã—ãŸã€‚ ä»¥ä¸‹ã„ãã¤ã‹ã®å•é¡Œã‚’ãƒ”ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã—ã¦ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚

å•é¡Œï¼ï¼šã¯ã˜ã‚ã¦ã®ã‚ã£ã¨ã“ãƒ¼ã ãƒ¼

ã‚ã–ã‚ã–å¹³ä»®åã§è¡¨è¨˜ã—ã¡ã‚ƒã£ã¦ã¾ã‚ã©ã‚“ãªæ¥å¾…ã‚’ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã®ã‚„ã‚‰...ã€‚å•é¡Œæ–‡ã‚’èª­ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚

é«˜æ©‹å›ã¯ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®åŠ å·¥ãŒè¡Œã„ãŸã„ã§ã™ã€‚ æ•´æ•° \(a,b,c\)ã¨ã€æ–‡å­—åˆ— \(s\) ãŒä¸ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚æ•´æ•° \(a+b+c\) ã®è¨ˆç®—çµæœã¨ã€æ–‡å­—åˆ— \(s\) ã‚’ä¸¦ã¹ã¦è¡¨ç¤ºã—ãªã•ã„ã€‚

åˆ¶ç´„

  • \(1\leq a, b, c \leq 1,000\)

$$ \begin{align*} &a\\ &b\quad c\\ &s \end{align*} $$

\(a+b+c\)ã¨\(s\)ã‚’ç©ºç™½åŒºåˆ‡ã‚Šã§1è¡Œã«å‡ºåŠ›ã›ã‚ˆã€‚

ã‚“ï¼Ÿå…¥åŠ›ã£ã¦ãªã‚“ã ï¼Ÿ(ç«¶ãƒ—ãƒ­åˆå¿ƒè€…ä¸¦æ„Ÿ) ã„ã‚„å…¥åŠ›ã¯inputã‚’ä½¿ãˆã°ã„ã„ã€ã§ã‚‚ã€Œb cã€ã¯ã©ã†ã‚„ã£ã¦å…¥åŠ›ã™ã‚‹ã‚“ã ï¼Ÿ(Pythonåˆå¿ƒè€…ä¸¦æ„Ÿ)

......(æ€è€ƒåœæ­¢)

æ•°å•è§£ã„ãŸå¾Œã®è©±ã§ã™ãŒã€æ°—ä»˜ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ ã‚ã‚ã“ã‚ŒãŒç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ãªã®ã‹ã€‚ ã‚ã‚Œã§ã™ã€åˆå¿ƒè€…ã‚ã‚‹ã‚ã‚‹ã®ã€Œæ€ã£ã¦ãŸã®ã¨é•ã†ã€ã£ã¦ã‚„ã¤ã§ã™ã€‚ä»Šå›ã®ã¯æ‚ªã„æ„å‘³ã§ã¯ãªã„ã®ã§ã™ãŒã€‚è¨€èªã¤ãªãŒã‚Šã§ã€ä¾‹ãˆã°è‹±èªã®å•é¡Œãªã‚‰ã€æ–‡æ³•ã‚„èª­è§£ã€å’Œæ–‡è‹±è¨³ãªã©å—é¨“ã§ã•ã‚“ã–ã‚“ã‚„ã£ãŸå½¢å¼ã®ã‚‚ã®ãŒæ€ã„æµ®ã‹ã³ã¾ã™ã€‚ã¦ã£ãã‚Šãã†ã„ã†é¡ã„ã®å•é¡ŒãŒå‡ºã‚‹ã®ã‹ãªã¨æ€ã£ã¦ã„ãŸã‚‰ã€å®Œå…¨ã«å®Ÿè·µå½¢å¼ã®å•é¡Œã§é©šãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚è‹±èªå§‹ã‚ãŸã°ã£ã‹ã‚Šã§ã€ã„ããªã‚Šè‹±ä¼šè©±ã—ã‚ˆã†ã¨è¨€ã‚ã‚ŒãŸã‚‰èª°ã ã£ã¦ãã†ãªã‚‹ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚

ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã§ã¯ç­”ãˆãŒæ±ºã¾ã£ã¦ã¯ãªãã€ã‹ãªã‚Šã®ãƒãƒªã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãŒã‚ã‚Šã€ç‹¬è‡ªã«è€ƒãˆãŸãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ãŒç­”ãˆã«ãªã‚Šå¾—ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã®ãŒé¢ç™½ã¿ã®ä¸€ã¤ã§ã™ã­ã€‚ã¾ãŸã€åŒã˜æ–¹é‡ã§ã‚‚è¡¨è¨˜ã®ä»•æ–¹ãŒãŸãã•ã‚“ã‚ã£ã¦ã€ã¾ã‚‹ã§æ–¹è¨€ã®ã‚ˆã†ã§ã™ã€‚

ã¾ã¨ã‚ã£ã½ããªã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸãŒå•é¡Œã«æˆ»ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚è€ƒãˆã¦ã‚‚åˆ†ã‹ã‚‹è¨³ãªã•ãã†ãªã®ã§ã€ã“ã®å•é¡Œã«ã ã‘ã¤ã„ã¦ã„ã‚‹è§£ç­”ä¾‹ã‚’è¦‹ã¾ã™ã€‚

map ã¨ã‹ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã¨ã‹ã€å¤šåˆ†è¦‹ã‚‹ã®ãŒï¼’ãƒ¶æœˆã¶ã‚Šã¨ã‹ã§ã€ã‚ã‚ãã†ã„ãˆã°ãã‚“ãªã®ã‚ã£ãŸãªçŠ¶æ…‹ã§ã™ã€‚

å•é¡Œï¼”ï¼šCoins

ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ”ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã£ã½ãã¦å°è±¡çš„ãªå•é¡Œã§ã™ã€‚ã‚ˆãã¿ã‚‹æ•´æ•°å•é¡Œã§ã™ã­ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯ç°¡å˜ã«è§£ã‘ã‚‹ã¨æ€ã„ãã‚„...ï¼Ÿã“ã†ã„ã†å•é¡Œã¯å—é¨“æ•°å­¦çš„ã«ã¯ãƒ‘ãƒ‘ãƒƒã¨å ´åˆåˆ†ã‘ãŒæµ®ã‹ã³ã¾ã™ãŒã€ãã®æ¡ä»¶åˆ†ã‘ã‚’å®Ÿè£…ã™ã‚‹ã®ã¯é¢å€’ã§ã™ã€‚ãã†ã€å—é¨“å•é¡Œã§ã¯å…¥åŠ›ãŒï¼‘ã¤ã ã‘ã§ã™ãŒã€ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã§ã¯è¤‡æ•°ã®å…¥åŠ›ãŒãªã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãŸã‚ã€å…¨ã¦ã®å ´åˆåˆ†ã‘ã«å¯¾å¿œã—ãªã„ã¨ã„ã‘ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ã§ããªã„ã“ã¨ã¯ãªã„ã§ã™ãŒã€æ­£ç›´è¨€ã£ã¦ã‹ãªã‚Šé¢å€’ã§ã™ã€‚

å•é¡Œæ–‡

ã‚ãªãŸã¯ã€500å††ç‰ã‚’\(A\)æšã€100å††ç‰ã‚’\(B\)æšã€50å††ç‰ã‚’\(C\)æšæŒã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®ç¡¬è²¨ã®ä¸­ã‹ã‚‰ä½•æšã‹ã‚’é¸ã³ã€åˆè¨ˆé‡‘é¡ã‚’ã¡ã‚‡ã†ã©\(X\)å††ã«ã™ã‚‹æ–¹æ³•ã¯ä½•é€šã‚Šã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚ åŒã˜ç¨®é¡ã®ç¡¬è²¨åŒå£«ã¯åŒºåˆ¥ã§ãã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ï¼’é€šã‚Šã®ç¡¬è²¨ã®é¸ã³æ–¹ã¯ã€ã‚ã‚‹ç¨®é¡ã®ç¡¬è²¨ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ãã®ç¡¬è²¨ã‚’é¸ã¶æšæ•°ãŒç•°ãªã‚‹ã¨ãåŒºåˆ¥ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

åˆ¶ç´„

  • \(0 \leq A, B, C \leq 50\)
  • \(A+B+C \geq 1\)
  • \(50 \leq X \leq 20,000\)
  • \(A,B,C\) ã¯æ•´æ•°ã§ã‚ã‚‹
  • \(X\)ã¯50ã®å€æ•°ã§ã‚ã‚‹

å…¥åŠ›

å…¥åŠ›ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å½¢å¼ã§æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰ä¸ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚

$$ \begin{align*} ã€€&A\\ ã€€&B\\ ã€€&C\\ ã€€&X \end{align*} $$

å‡ºåŠ›

ç¡¬è²¨ã‚’é¸ã¶æ–¹æ³•ã®å€‹æ•°ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›ã›ã‚ˆã€‚ 

a, b, c, x = map(int, [input() for i in range(4)])
ans = 0
for i in range(a+1):
    for j in range(b+1):
        for k in range(c+1):
            if i * 500 + j * 100 + k * 50 == x:
                ans += 1
print(ans)

(http://delta114514.hatenablog.jp/entry/2018/03/15/014555 ã‚ˆã‚Šå¼•ç”¨)

ã—ã°ã‚‰ãå ´åˆåˆ†ã‘ã‚’è€ƒãˆã¦ã„ã¾ã—ãŸãŒã€ã‚®ãƒ–ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã—ã¦ç­”ãˆã‚’æ¤œç´¢ã€‚ABSã¯æœ‰åã‚‰ã—ãè‰²ã‚“ãªäººãŒè‰²ã‚“ãªè¨€èªã§è§£ç­”ã‚’ã‚ã’ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ ã“ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯ã¤ã¾ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚ã€ç·å½“ãŸã‚Šã‚’ã—ã¦æ¡ä»¶ã‚’æº€ãŸã™ã‚‚ã®ã‚’ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆã—ã¦ã‚‹ã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚ãªã‚‹ã»ã©ï¼ãƒ’ãƒˆãŒè¨ˆç®—ã™ã‚‹ãªã‚‰ã“ã‚“ãªé¢å€’ãªã“ã¨ã¯ã—ãªã„ã‘ã‚Œã©ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ”ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãªã‚‰ã§ãã‚‹ã€‚ã¯ã£ã¨ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

å•é¡Œï¼—ï¼šKagami Mochi

å•é¡Œæ–‡

\(X\)æ®µé‡ã­ã®é¡é¤…(\(X\geq 1\)) ã¨ã¯\(X\)æšã®å††å½¢ã®é¤…ã‚’ç¸¦ã«ç©ã¿é‡ã­ãŸã‚‚ã®ã§ã‚ã£ã¦ã€ã©ã®é¤…ã‚‚ãã®çœŸä¸‹ã®é¤…ã‚ˆã‚Šç›´å¾„ãŒå°ã•ã„ï¼ˆä¸€ç•ªä¸‹ã®é¤…ã‚’é™¤ãï¼‰ã‚‚ã®ã®ã“ã¨ã§ã™ã€‚ ä¾‹ãˆã°ã€ç›´å¾„10ã€8ã€6ã‚»ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ«ã®é¤…ã‚’ã“ã®é †ã«ä¸‹ã‹ã‚‰ç©ã¿é‡ã­ã‚‹ã¨3æ®µé‡ã­ã®é¡é¤…ã«ãªã‚Šã€ é¤…ã‚’ä¸€æšã ã‘ç½®ãã¨1æ®µé‡ã­ã®é¡é¤…ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ ãƒ€ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒ•ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®ãƒ«ãƒ³ãƒ«ãƒ³ã¯\(N\)æšã®å††å½¢ã®é¤…ã‚’æŒã£ã¦ã„ã¦ã€ãã®ã†ã¡\(i\) æšç›®ã®é¤…ã®ç›´å¾„ã¯\(d_i\)ã‚»ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ«ã§ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®é¤…ã®ã†ã¡ä¸€éƒ¨ã¾ãŸã¯å…¨éƒ¨ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦é¡é¤…ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã¨ãã€ æœ€å¤§ã§ä½•æ®µé‡ã­ã®é¡é¤…ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ã€‚

åˆ¶ç´„

  • \(1 \leq N \leq 100\)
  • \(1 \leq d_i \leq 100\)
  • å…¥åŠ›å€¤ã¯å…¨ã¦æ•´æ•°ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã€‚

å…¥åŠ›

å…¥åŠ›ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å½¢å¼ã§æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰ä¸ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚

$$ \begin{align*} &N\\ &d_1\\ &ï¼š\\ &d_N \end{align*} $$

å‡ºåŠ›

ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨ã®ã§ãã‚‹é¡é¤…ã®æœ€å¤§ã®æ®µæ•°ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›ã›ã‚ˆã€‚

æ™®é€šã®è§£æ³•

n = int(input())
print(len(set(map(int, [input() for i in range(n)]))))

(http://delta114514.hatenablog.jp/entry/2018/03/15/014555 ã‚ˆã‚Šå¼•ç”¨)
å…¥åŠ›ã‚’ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆã«ã—ã¦ã‹ã‚‰ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã«ã—ã¦è¦ç´ æ•°ã‚’æ•°ãˆã‚‹ã€‚å½“ç„¶ã§ã™ã­ã€‚åƒ•ã¯ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã®å­˜åœ¨ã‚’æ€ã„å‡ºã›ãªã‹ã£ãŸã®ã§ã€æ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

åƒ•ã®è§£æ³•

ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã‹ã‚‰ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆã®ã¾ã¾ã§ãªã‚“ã¨ã‹æ•°ãˆã‚ã’ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚æ˜ã‚‰ã‹ã«æ±šã„ã§ã™ã­ã€‚é•·ã„ã§ã™ã—ã€n=1ã§å ´åˆåˆ†ã‘ã—ã¦ã¾ã™ã—ã€‚ã“ã‚“ãªåˆå¿ƒè€…ã˜ã¿ãŸç­”ãˆã§ã‚‚åˆã£ã¦ãŸã‚‰ã„ã„ã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚

n = int(input())
a = sorted(list(map(int, [input() for i in range(n)])))
ans = 1
if n != 1:
    for i in range(n-1):
        if a[i] < a[i+1]:
            ans += 1
print(ans)

å•é¡Œï¼™ï¼šDaydream

å•é¡Œæ–‡ã®é€šã‚Šã«ã€å¾Œã‚ã‹ã‚‰ï¼”å˜èªã®ã©ã‚Œã‹ã‚’æ¤œç´¢ã—ã¦ã„ãã®ãŒä¸€ç•ªã‚ã‹ã‚Šã‚„ã™ã„ã¨æ€ã‚ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ãŒã€ã‚ã–ã‚ã–eraseã¨ã„ã†å˜èªã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§ããŸã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã¯ã€ã“ã†ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚

å•é¡Œæ–‡

è‹±å°æ–‡å­—ã‹ã‚‰ãªã‚‹æ–‡å­—åˆ—\(S\) ãŒä¸ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ \(T\)ãŒç©ºæ–‡å­—åˆ—ã§ã‚ã‚‹çŠ¶æ…‹ã‹ã‚‰å§‹ã‚ã€ ä»¥ä¸‹ã®æ“ä½œã‚’å¥½ããªå›æ•°ç¹°ã‚Šè¿”ã™ã“ã¨ã§ \(S=T\) ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã‹åˆ¤å®šã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ - \(T\)ã®æœ«å°¾ã«dream dreamer erase eraser ã®ã„ãšã‚Œã‹ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹ã€‚

åˆ¶ç´„

  • \(1\leq |S|\leq 10^5\)
  • \(S\)ã¯è‹±å°æ–‡å­—ã‹ã‚‰ãªã‚‹ã€‚

å…¥åŠ›

å…¥åŠ›ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å½¢å¼ã§æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰ä¸ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚

$$S$$

å‡ºåŠ›

\(S=T\)ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹å ´åˆ'YES'ã‚’ã€ãã†ã§ãªã„å ´åˆ'NO'ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›ã›ã‚ˆã€‚

if d.strip() == "":

æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®å¾Œã‚ã‹ã‚‰ã ã‘ã§ãªãã€é€”ä¸­ã‹ã‚‰æŠœã„ã¦ã‚‚ã€æŠœãå˜èªã®é †ç•ªã‚’ã†ã¾ãæ±ºã‚ã‚Œã°å•é¡Œãªã„ã¯ãšã§ã™ã€‚
å¤‰æ•°ã‚’ã„ã¡ã„ã¡ç½®ã„ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ãŒæ¥ãšã‹ã—ã„ã§ã™ãŒã€é€šã‚Œã°ã„ã„ã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚

(http://delta114514.hatenablog.jp/entry/2018/03/15/014555 ã‚ˆã‚Šå¼•ç”¨)
é€šã‚Œã°ãªã‚“ã§ã‚‚ã„ã„ã¯ãšãªã‚“ã§ã™ãŒã€ã“ã‚Œã¯ã©ã†ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚ã“ã®è§£ç­”ä¾‹ã ã¨ã€'d erase r erase e erase a erase m' ã¨ã„ã†æ–‡å­—åˆ—(ã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯æŠœã„ã¦ãã ã•ã„)ã‚‚YESã«ãªã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã†ã¯ãšãªã®ã§ã™ãŒã€è©¦ã—ã«ã“ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’æå‡ºã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã¨acceptã•ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚(å˜˜è§£æ³•ãªã‚“ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ï¼Ÿã«ã—ã¦ã¯åŒã˜ã‚ˆã†ãªç­”ãˆã‚’æ›¸ã„ã¦ã‚‹äººãŒå¤§å‹¢ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚)

åˆå­¦è€…ã«ã¨ã£ã¦ã®ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°

è§£ã„ã¦ã¿ãŸæ„Ÿæƒ³ã§ã™ãŒã€ã‚„ã¯ã‚Šè€ƒãˆã‚‹ã®ã¯æ¥½ã—ã„ã§ã™ã€‚ä¹…ã€…ã«æ•°å­¦çš„ãªé ­ã®ä½¿ã„æ–¹ã‚’ã—ã¦æ‡ã‹ã—ã•ã‚‚è¦šãˆã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ ã¾ãŸã€ä½•ã‚ˆã‚Šã€ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã¯åˆå­¦è€…ã«ã‹ãªã‚Šä¾¿åˆ©ãªã‚‚ã®ã ã¨æ„Ÿã˜ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã»ã‚“ã¨ã«åŸºç¤çš„ãªéƒ¨åˆ†ã—ã‹å­¦ç¿’ã—ã¦ãªãã¦ã‚‚è§£ã‘ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã®ã¯å–ã‚Šçµ„ã¿ã‚„ã™ã„ã§ã™ã—ã€çµæœãŒã ã›ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯å¬‰ã—ã„ã§ã™ã€‚éå»å•ãªã‚‰ãƒãƒƒãƒˆä¸Šã«ãŸãã•ã‚“è§£èª¬ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ã¤ã¾ã£ã¦ã‚‚ãªã‚“ã¨ã‹ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

ä»–ã®äººã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã€è€ƒãˆæ–¹ã®å¹…ã‚‚åºƒãŒã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ä¸Šæ‰‹ãæ›¸ã‘ãªã‹ã£ãŸã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’è¦‹ç›´ã—ãŸã‚Šã€ç•°ãªã£ãŸæ–¹é‡ã§æ›¸ã‹ã‚ŒãŸã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã®ã¯ã„ã„åˆºæ¿€ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ ç‰¹ã«åŸºç¤ã®æ–‡æ³•ã«æ…£ã‚Œã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ç‚¹ã§ã¯ä¸€ç•ªã ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚åŸºç¤ã‚’æ´—ç·´ã•ã›ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯å¿…ãšã“ã®å…ˆãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚„ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ãã«ã—ã¦ã‚‚ã€ç†è§£ã—ã¦æ‰±ãˆã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãå½¹ã«ç«‹ã¤ã“ã¨ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚

ã‚‚ã¡ã‚ã‚“ä¸‡èƒ½ã§ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã®å†…å®¹ã¯ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ä¸€èˆ¬ã‹ã‚‰è¦‹ã¦åã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã§ã™ã€‚ã€Œç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã€€ãƒ‡ãƒ¡ãƒªãƒƒãƒˆã€ã§èª¿ã¹ã‚‹ã¨æ‰¹åˆ¤ãŒãŸãã•ã‚“å‡ºã¦ãã¾ã™ã€‚

ã§ã‚‚å°‘ãªãã¨ã‚‚Pythonä¼šã«å…¥ã£ã¦ã‚‹åˆå¿ƒè€…ã®äººã¯ã€ã‚½ãƒ•ãƒˆé–‹ç™ºã®ã‚ˆã†ãªèƒ½åŠ›ã§ã¯ãªãã€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã‚’ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¨ã—ã¦æ‰±ãˆã‚‹èƒ½åŠ›ã‚’æ±‚ã‚ã¦ã„ã‚‹äººãŒã»ã¨ã‚“ã©ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ã‚‰ã€ã†ã£ã¦ã¤ã‘ã®æ•™æã ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ç°¡å˜ãªãƒ–ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯å´©ã—ã®ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚’ä½œã£ãŸã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ãŒã€ä»Šå›ã®æ–¹ãŒã‚ˆã£ã½ã©ç·´ç¿’ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã‚‚ã—èˆˆå‘³ãŒã‚ã‚Œã°çš†ã•ã‚“ã‚‚æ˜¯éè©¦ã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

entry.title: Estimation statisticsã«åŸºã¥ã„ãŸãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®å¯è¦–åŒ–ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒª -DABEST-
entry.content:
ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’å¯è¦–åŒ–ã™ã‚‹æ‰‹æ³•ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€æ£’ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•(Barplot), ç®±ã²ã’å›³(Boxplot), Jitter plot, Violin plot ãªã©ãŒã‚ˆãç”¨ã„ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ã—ã‹ã—ã€ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®å¯è¦–åŒ–æ‰‹æ³•ã¯ æœ‰æ„å·®æ¤œå®š(null hypothesis significance testing; NHST) ã®çµæœã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚æœ‰æ„å·®æ¤œå®šã¯æ§˜ã€…ãªåˆ†é‡ã®ç ”ç©¶ã«ãŠã„ã¦åºƒãç”¨ã„ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€çµ±è¨ˆæ¤œå®šã®çµæœã®è©•ä¾¡ã«på€¤ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯äºŒåˆ†çš„ãªè©•ä¾¡ã«ç¹‹ãŒã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™(ä¾‹ãˆã°p<0.05ãªã‚‰OKã§p>0.05ãªã‚‰ãƒ€ãƒ¡ã€ã¨ã„ã†åˆ¤æ–­)ã€‚ä¸€æ–¹ã§ã€Estimation Statisticsã¯på€¤ã§ã¯ãªã åŠ¹æœé‡(effect size) ã«é‡ãã‚’ç½®ãã¾ã™ã€‚ã¤ã¾ã‚Šã€åŠ¹æœãŒã‚ã‚‹/ãªã—ã§ã¯ãªãã€ã©ã®ãã‚‰ã„åŠ¹æœãŒã‚ã‚‹ã‹ã€ã‚’é‡è¦–ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã§ã™ã€‚

ä»Šå›ç´¹ä»‹ã™ã‚‹ DABEST (Data Analysis using Bootstrap-coupled ESTimation)ã¯Estimation Statisticsã«åŸºã¥ã„ãŸãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®å¯è¦–åŒ–ã‚’è¡Œã†ãŸã‚ã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªï¼ˆãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ï¼‰ã§ã™ã€‚ Python, R, Matlab ã«å¯¾å¿œã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã¯DABESTã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã®è«–æ–‡ã§ã™ã€‚

J. Ho, T. Tumkaya, S. Aryal, H. Choi, A. Claridge-Chang. Moving beyond P values: Everyday data analysis with estimation plots. Nature Methods. (2019), 1548-7105. 10.1038/s41592-019-0470-3. (Nature Methods, bioRxiv)

ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒª

DABESTã«ã¯Python(DABEST-Python)ã¨R(dabestr), Matlab(DABEST-Matlab)ã§ã®å®Ÿè£…ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®è¨˜äº‹ã§ã¯Pythonã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

Estimation Stats

ã“ã®DABESTã«ã¯è‘—è€…ã‚‰ã«ã‚ˆã‚‹å„ªã‚ŒãŸHP(Estimation Stats)ãŒå­˜åœ¨ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®HPã«ã¯Estimation statisticsã¨DABESTã§ç”¨ã„ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹æ‰‹æ³•ã®è§£èª¬ãŒã‚ã‚Šã€ã•ã‚‰ã«csvãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹ã ã‘ã§Estimation statisticsã«åŸºã¥ã„ãŸãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®å¯è¦–åŒ–ãŒã§ãã‚‹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’æ›¸ãå¿…è¦ã¯ãªãã€åŠ¹æœé‡ã¨ã—ã¦ã©ã®æŒ‡æ¨™ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã‚‹ã‹(Mean difference, Median difference, Cohen's d, hedges' g, Cliff's deltaãªã©)ã‚‚é¸æŠã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚

DABESTãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒªã‚¢ãƒ«

DABESTã®ãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒªã‚¢ãƒ«ã¯æ—¢ã«ç”¨æ„ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™(Tutorial-dabest 0.2.4 documentation)ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã§ã¯ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®æ–¹æ³•ã¨ç°¡å˜ãªä½¿ã„æ–¹ã®ç´¹ä»‹ã‚’ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«

DABEST(0.24)ã¯æ¬¡ã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã«ä¾å­˜ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™(æ‹¬å¼§å†…ã¯ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³)ï¼š numpy(1.15), scipy(1.2), matplotlib(3.0), seaborn(0.9), pandas(0.24)ã€‚åŸºæœ¬çš„ãªãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã§ã™ãŒã€å¿…è¦ã«å¿œã˜ã¦ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—(ã¾ãŸã¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³)ã—ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚DABESTã®ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¯æ¬¡ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã«ã‚ˆã‚Špipã§è¡Œã†ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚

pip install dabest

Quickstart

ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã—ãŸã‚‰ã€ã¨ã‚Šã‚ãˆãšã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒå‹•ãã‹ç¢ºèªã—ã¦ã¿ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import dabest

# Load the iris dataset. Requires internet access.
iris = pd.read_csv("https://github.com/mwaskom/seaborn-data/raw/master/iris.csv")

# Load the above data into `dabest`.
iris_dabest = dabest.load(data=iris, x="species", y="petal_width",
                          idx=("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"))

# Produce a Cumming estimation plot and save plot.
iris_dabest.mean_diff.plot(fig_size=(5,7))
plt.savefig("quick_start.png")

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ãŒå‡ºåŠ›ã•ã‚Œã‚Œã°æˆåŠŸã§ã™ã€‚

ã“ã®ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã¯ Cumming plot ã¨ã„ã†å¯è¦–åŒ–ã®æ–¹æ³•ã§ã™ã€‚Estimation statisticsã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹å¯è¦–åŒ–ã®æ–¹æ³•ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã‚‚ã†1ã¤ Gardner-Altman plot ã¨ã„ã†ã‚‚ã®ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã§ã¯ã“ã®2ã¤ã®å¯è¦–åŒ–æ–¹æ³•ã®è¦‹æ–¹ã¨ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ç´¹ä»‹ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

Gardner-Altman plot

Gardner-Altman plot ã¯M. Gardnerã¨D. Altmanã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ææ¡ˆã•ã‚ŒãŸæç”»æ³•ã§ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã¯Gardner-Altman plotã®ä¾‹ã§ã™ã€‚å›³ã®å·¦å´ã§ã¯ä¸¡æ–¹ã®ç¾¤ã®ã™ã¹ã¦ã®è¦³æ¸¬å€¤ã‚’Jitter plotã«ã‚ˆã‚Šè¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚å³å´ã«ã‚ã‚‹ã®ã¯åŠ¹æœé‡ã®è»¸ã§ã€åŠ¹æœé‡ã®ç‚¹æ¨å®š(é»’ä¸¸)ã¨ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“(ç¸¦ã®é»’æ£’)ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®åŠ¹æœé‡ã®ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã§ã™ãŒã€ã“ã‚Œã¯ Bootstrapæ³• ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦ç®—å‡ºã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ãªãŠã€Bootstrapæ³•ã«é–¢ã—ã¦ã¯å¾Œã§è©³ã—ãè¿°ã¹ã¾ã™ã€‚

ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯æ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import dabest

np.random.seed(20190623)

# Generate toy dataset
x1 = np.random.normal(loc=50, scale=10, size=50)
x2 = np.random.normal(loc=60, scale=5, size=40)
df = pd.DataFrame(data=[x1, x2]).T
df.columns = ['Control', 'Test']

# Load the above data into `dabest`.
df_dabest = dabest.load(data=df, idx=("Control", "Test"))
df_dabest.mean_diff.plot(fig_size=(5,4))
#df_dabest.cohens_d.plot(fig_size=(5,4))
plt.savefig("ga1.png", bbox_inches="tight")

Gardner-Altman plotã«ã¯ å¯¾å¿œã®ã‚ã‚‹2ç¾¤(paired) ã®ãŸã‚ã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

ã“ã“ã§ã¯åŠ¹æœé‡ã¨ã—ã¦ Cohen's d ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯æ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™(ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã®ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã¯çœç•¥)ã€‚

# Generate toy dataset
size = 20
idx = np.arange(0, size)
x1 = np.random.normal(loc=50, scale=10, size=size)
x2 = np.random.normal(loc=60, scale=10, size=size)
df = pd.DataFrame(data=[idx, x1, x2]).T
df.columns = ['idx', 'Control', 'Test']

# Load the above data into `dabest`.
df_dabest = dabest.load(data=df, idx=("Control", "Test"),
                        paired=True, id_col="idx")

df_dabest.cohens_d.plot(fig_size=(4,4))
#df_dabest.mean_diff.plot(fig_size=(4,4))
plt.savefig("ga2.png", bbox_inches="tight")

Cumming plot

Cumming plot ã¯G. Cummingã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ææ¡ˆã•ã‚ŒãŸæç”»æ³•ã§ã™ã€‚è¤‡æ•°ã®ç¾¤ã«å¯¾ã—ã¦2ã¤ä»¥ä¸Šã®åŠ¹æœé‡ãŠã‚ˆã³ãã‚Œã‚‰ã®ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã‚’ã€ä»Šåº¦ã¯è¦³æ¸¬ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®ä¸‹ã«æç”»ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ã“ã“ã§ã¯åŠ¹æœé‡ã¨ã—ã¦ hedges' g ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯æ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™(ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã®ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã¯çœç•¥)ã€‚ 

# Generate toy dataset
size1 = 20
size2 = 25

xc1 = np.random.normal(loc=50, scale=20, size=size1)
xt1 = np.random.normal(loc=55, scale=15, size=size1)
xc2 = np.random.normal(loc=60, scale=15, size=size2)
xt2 = np.random.normal(loc=50, scale=25, size=size2)
df = pd.DataFrame(data=[xc1, xt1, xc2, xt2]).T
df.columns = ['Control1', 'Test1', 'Control2', 'Test2']

# Load the above data into `dabest`.
df_dabest = dabest.load(data=df, idx=(("Control1", "Test1"),
                                      ("Control2", "Test2")))

#df_dabest.cohens_d.plot(fig_size=(5,5))
#df_dabest.mean_diff.plot(fig_size=(5,5))
df_dabest.hedges_g.plot(fig_size=(5,5))
plt.savefig("cumming.png", bbox_inches="tight")

Bootstrap Confidence Intervalã«ã¤ã„ã¦

Bootstrapæ³•ã§ç®—å‡ºã™ã‚‹ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã‚’ Bootstrap Confidence Interval ã¨ã„ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã‚’å‡ºã™ãŸã‚ã«ã¯å¤šæ•°ã®ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ãŒå¿…è¦ã§ã™ãŒã€Bootstrapæ³•ã«ã‚ˆã‚Šç–‘ä¼¼çš„ã«å®Ÿé¨“ã‚’ç¹°ã‚Šè¿”ã—ã€2ç¾¤é–“ã§ã®åŠ¹æœé‡ã‚’ç®—å‡ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§å¤šæ•°ã®åŠ¹æœé‡ã®ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã‚’å¾—ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§è§£æ±ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

DABESTã«ã‚ˆã‚‹å®Ÿè£…ã‚’ç”¨ã„ãšã«åŠ¹æœé‡ã®ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã‚’æç”»ã—ã¦ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚æ­£è¦åˆ†å¸ƒã«å¾“ã†2ã¤ã®ç¾¤(N(50, 202), N(60, 202))ã‹ã‚‰ãã‚Œãã‚Œ50ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã‚’å¾—ãŸã¨ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚åŠ¹æœé‡ã‚’å¹³å‡ã®å·®ã¨ã—ã¦ã€5000å›ãƒ–ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ã‚’è¡Œã„ã€åŠ¹æœé‡ã®ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã‚’5000å€‹å¾—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®å ´åˆã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚æç”»ã®ãŸã‚ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒå¤šã„ã§ã™ãŒã€np.random.choice(x, size, replace=True)ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã‚Œã°ã‚ˆã„ã€ã¨ã„ã†ã®ãŒå¤§äº‹ãªéƒ¨åˆ†ã§ã™ã€‚

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

np.random.seed(20190623)

# generate observation (toy data)
size = 50 # sample size
sigma = 20
mu1 = 50
mu2 = 60
diff_mu = abs(mu2 - mu1)

x1_obs = np.random.normal(loc=mu1, scale=sigma, size=size)
x2_obs = np.random.normal(loc=mu2, scale=sigma, size=size)

num_bootstrap = 5000
alpha = 0.025

es_bootstrap = np.zeros(num_bootstrap) # array to save bootstrapped effect size

for i in range(num_bootstrap):
    # bootstrapping
    x1_resampling = np.random.choice(x1_obs, size=size, replace=True)
    x2_resampling = np.random.choice(x2_obs, size=size, replace=True)

    # calculate effect size (mean difference) and save.
    mu = np.mean(x2_resampling) - np.mean(x1_resampling)
    es_bootstrap[i] += mu

# plot
ax = sns.kdeplot(es_bootstrap, shade=True)

data_x, data_y = ax.lines[0].get_data()
plt.vlines(0, ymin=0, ymax=data_y.max(), color='k', linestyle='dashed')
plt.vlines(diff_mu, ymin=0, ymax=data_y.max(), color='r', linestyle='dashed')
plt.vlines(np.mean(es_bootstrap), ymin=0, ymax=data_y.max(), color='g')
es_bootstrap_sorted = np.sort(es_bootstrap) # to plot 95% CI
idx_alpha = np.argmin(np.abs(data_x-es_bootstrap_sorted[int(num_bootstrap*alpha)]))
idx_one_m_alpha = np.argmin(np.abs(data_x-es_bootstrap_sorted[int(num_bootstrap*(1-alpha))]))
plt.vlines(es_bootstrap_sorted[int(num_bootstrap*alpha)], ymin=0, ymax=data_y[idx_alpha])
plt.vlines(es_bootstrap_sorted[int(num_bootstrap*(1-alpha))], ymin=0, ymax=data_y[idx_one_m_alpha])
plt.xlabel("Mean difference")
plt.ylabel("Density")
#plt.show()
plt.savefig("bootstrap_ci.png")

çµæœã¯æ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

æ¨ªè»¸ãŒå¹³å‡ã®å·®ã€ç¸¦è»¸ãŒå¯†åº¦ã§ã™ã€‚é»’ç ´ç·šã¯0, èµ¤ç ´ç·šã¯çœŸã®åˆ†å¸ƒã®å¹³å‡ã®å·®(ä»Šå›ã§ã‚ã‚Œã°10)ã€ç·‘å®Ÿç·šã¯åŠ¹æœé‡ã®ç‚¹æ¨å®š(è¦ã¯å¹³å‡å€¤)ã§ã™ã€‚é»’å®Ÿç·šã¯ç¬¬1, 3å››åˆ†ä½æ•°ã§ã€ã“ã®é–“ã‚’95%ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã¨è¿‘ä¼¼ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™(ã“ã®ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã®ç®—å‡ºæ‰‹æ³•ã‚’ ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚»ãƒ³ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ«æ³• ã¨ã„ã„ã¾ã™)ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯ç°¡æ˜“ãªæ‰‹æ³•ã§ã™ãŒã€ä»–ã«ã‚‚ç®—å‡ºæ–¹æ³•ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

ã¾ã¨ã‚

  • på€¤ã¨å…±ã«åŠ¹æœé‡ã‚‚å ±å‘Šã—ã‚ˆã†ã€‚
  • åŠ¹æœé‡ã‚‚å›³ã®ä¸­ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã‚ˆã†ã€‚
  • DABEST ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã‚Œã°ç°¡å˜ã«åŠ¹æœé‡ã¨ãã®ç²¾åº¦(ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“)ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã§ãã‚‹ã€‚

å‚è€ƒæ–‡çŒ®

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estimation_statistics
  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bootstrapping_(statistics)
  • çµ±è¨ˆå­¦ã®æ™‚é–“ï¼ˆåŠ¹æœé‡1, åŠ¹æœé‡2ï¼‰
  • å²¡ç”°è¬™ä»‹. å¿ƒç†å­¦ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹åŠ¹æœé‡ã‚’ã‚ãã‚‹æœ€è¿‘ã®è©±é¡Œ. (pdf)
  • æ±ªé‡‘èŠ³. ãƒ–ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—æ³•å…¥é–€. (pdf)

entry.title: Mockinbirdã‚’ç”¨ã„ãŸPAR-CLIPè§£æ
entry.content:
ä»Šå›ã¯ PAR-CLIP è§£æã®All-in-oneãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ•ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¢ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã€Mockinbirdã‚’ç´¹ä»‹ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚æ—¥æœ¬èªã§ã®æƒ…å ±ãŒã»ã¼ãªãã€èª¬æ˜ãŒé•·ããªã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã„ãã†ãªã®ã§ã€ï¼’å›ã«åˆ†ã‘ã¦æ›¸ãã¾ã™ã€‚

PAR-CLIPã£ã¦ä½•ï¼Ÿ

PAR-CLIPã¯ photoactivatable ribonucleoside-enhanced crosslinking and immunoprecipitation ã®ç•¥ã§RNAã‚„microRNAçµåˆã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¯ã®çµåˆã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã‚’ç‰¹å®šã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã«ä½¿ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

å®Ÿé¨“æ³•ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€ã¾ãš4SUï¼ˆ4-ãƒã‚ªã‚¦ãƒªã‚¸ãƒ³ï¼‰ã‚’ç´°èƒåŸ¹åœ°ä¸­ã«æ·»åŠ ã—ã€4SUã«ã‚ˆã‚‹ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«æ¨™è­˜ã‚’è¡Œã„ã¾ã™ã€‚æ¬¡ã«UVã®ç…§å°„ã‚’è¡Œã„ã€RNAçµåˆã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¯ã¨RNAã®é–“ã§æ¶æ©‹åå¿œã‚’èµ·ã“ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ãã®å¾Œã€RBPã¨çµåˆã—ãŸãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®æŠ½å‡ºã‚’è¡Œã„ã€ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã¨ã—ã¦ç”¨ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«RNAã‚’é€†è»¢å†™ã™ã‚‹ã¨ãã«ã€4SUãŒã‚·ãƒˆã‚·ãƒ³( C )ã«ç½®æ›ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™(misread)ã€‚ãã®ãŸã‚ã€ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒãƒ”ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚’å½¢æˆã—ã€ã‹ã¤T -> Cç½®æ›ãŒå…¥ã£ã¦ã„ãŸå ´åˆã€RBPã¨çµåˆã—ã¦ã„ãŸå¯èƒ½æ€§ãŒé«˜ã„ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã‚ã‚‹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¯ãŒã€RNAã®ã©ã®é ˜åŸŸã«çµåˆã™ã‚‹ã®ã‹ï¼Ÿçµåˆé ˜åŸŸé–“ã§ã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªç›¸äº’ä½œç”¨ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã‹ã‚’çŸ¥ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ç‰¹ã«ä¸€å¡©åŸºã¨ã„ã†é«˜ã„è§£åƒåº¦ã§ã®è§£æãŒã§ãã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒç‰¹å¾´ã§ã™ã€‚

Mockinbirdã¨ã¯ï¼Ÿ

å…¬å¼ãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã€GitHubã«è©³ç´°ã¯è¨˜è¼‰ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€æ—¥æœ¬èªã§ã®æƒ…å ±ãŒå°‘ãªã„ã€ã¨ã„ã†ã‹å…¨ããªã„ã€‚ã®ã§ã¾ã¨ã‚ã¦ã„ããŸã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

PAR-CLIPã®è§£æã¯ç”Ÿã®FASTQãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‹ã‚‰ã€Quality Check -> Trimming -> Mapping -> Downstream Analysisã¨ã„ã†æµã‚Œã§è¡Œã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€ãã‚Œã‚‰ã™ã¹ã¦ã®è§£æã‚’Mockinbirdã§ã¯ä¸€æ°—ã«è¡Œã£ã¦ãã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ã¾ãŸã€MockinbirdModuleï¼ˆè©³ç´°ã¯å¾Œè¿°ï¼‰ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã“ã¨ã§mock PAR-CLIP experimentã‚’è€ƒæ…®ã«å…¥ã‚ŒãŸè§£æã‚’è¡Œã†ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã®ã‚‚å¤§ããªç‰¹å¾´ã§ã™ã€‚

{% set data_dir = "data" %}

â‘¡ general. å¿…é ˆæƒ…å ±ã®è¨­å®š ã‚¢ãƒ€ãƒ—ã‚¿ãƒ¼é…åˆ—ã®æŒ‡å®šã€ãƒªãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ¬ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®æŒ‡å®šã€UMI(Unique molecular identifiers)ã®æœ‰ç„¡ã€ã‚¹ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ‰æ•°ã®æŒ‡å®šã€‚

general:
    adapter5prime: GTTCAGAGTTCTACAGTCCGACGATC
    adapter3prime: TGGAATTCTCGGGTGCCAAGG
    genomefasta: {{ genome_fasta }}
    normalization_pileup: {{ norm_pileup }}
    rmTemp: yes
    n_threads: 4

reads:
    bc_5prime: 5
    bc_3prime: 0
    min_len: 20
    reference_nucleotide: T
    mutation_nucleotide: C

â‘£ pipeline. ä½¿ã†ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¨å„å¼•æ•°ã®è¨­å®š ã‚¯ã‚ªãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ -> ãƒˆãƒªãƒŸãƒ³ã‚° -> ãƒãƒƒãƒ”ãƒ³ã‚°

pipeline:
  - FastQCModule:
      outdir_name: fastQC_raw

  - UmiToolsExtractModule

  - SkewerAdapterClippingModule

  - ClippyAdapterClippingModule:
      clipped_5prime_bc: True

  - FastQCModule:
      outdir_name: fastQC_clipped
      genome_index: {{ bowtie_index }}

  - BamPPModule:
      remove_n_edge_mut: 2
      max_mut_per_read: 1
      min_mismatch_quality: 20

  - SortIndexModule:
     keep_all: yes

  - UmiToolsDedupModule

  - SortIndexModule:
     keep_all: yes

  - PileupModule:
     keep_all: yes

  - BamStatisticsModule

å…·ä½“çš„ãªæ–¹æ³•ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€ã¾ãš mock_processing = Trueã¨ã—ã€ mockinbird preprocess nrd1_mock.fastq nrd1_mock nrd1_mock preprocess.yamlã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã§{% if not mock_processing %}ã¾ã§ã§è§£æãŒã‚¹ãƒˆãƒƒãƒ—ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

PileupModule, BamStatisticsModuleã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ã€Mock Experimentã®.mpileupãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¨_stat.jsonãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãŒãã‚Œãã‚Œç”Ÿæˆã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ï¼ˆã“ã®äºŒã¤ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’æ¬¡ã«ä½¿ã†ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ï¼‰

æ¬¡ã«mock_processing = Falseã«æˆ»ã—ã€ $ mockinbird preprocess nrd1.fastq nrd1 nrd1 preprocess.yamlã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã™ã‚‹ã¨ä¸‹è¨˜ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚‚ä¸€ç·’ã«å®Ÿè¡Œã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

{% if not mock_processing %}

    - PredictionSitesModule:

{% endif %}

entry.content:
ã“ã‚“ã°ã‚“ã¯ã€‚ ä»Šå›ã¯ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¯ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ«ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã®ç´¹ä»‹ã‚’ã—ãŸã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ ã¨ã„ã£ã¦ã‚‚ã‚„ã‚Šå§‹ã‚ãŸã°ã£ã‹ãªã®ã§ã€é–“é•ã£ã¦ã„ãŸã‚‰ã”æŒ‡æ‘˜ãŠé¡˜ã„ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ ï¼ˆç”»åƒã¯ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ’ã‚šãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ’ã‚™ã‚·ã‚™ãƒ§ãƒ³æœ€å…ˆç«¯ã‚«ã‚™ã‚¤ãƒˆã‚™ã£ã¦æœ‰åãªæœ¬ã®å›³ã‹ã‚‰ã€ã‚¤ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ï¼‰

ãƒ»æ‰‹é † åŸºæœ¬ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ï¼”ã¤ã®ã‚µã‚¤ã‚¯ãƒ«ã‚’ç¹°ã‚Šè¿”ã™ã ã‘ã§ã™ã€‚ 1.ãƒªã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒªãƒ³ã‚° 2.äºˆæ¸¬ 3.è¦³æ¸¬ 4.å°¤åº¦è¨ˆç®— é‡ã¿ã®æ›´æ–° ã¨è¨€ã£ã¦ã‚‚åˆ†ã‹ã‚Šã«ãã‹ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã€ã‚¤ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã§è©±ã™ã¨ ã¾ãšç²’å­ï¼ˆãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¯ãƒ«ï¼‰ã‚’å…¨ä½“ã«æŒ¯ã‚Šã‹ã‘ã¾ã™â†’æŒ¯ã‚Šã‹ã‘ãŸãªã‹ã§ã€ã‚ã£ã¦ãã†ãªç²’å­ã ã‘ç”Ÿãæ®‹ã£ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã„ã€ãã‚Œä»¥å¤–ã¯æ¶ˆãˆã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚â†’ã‚ã£ã¦ãã†ãªã‚‚ã®ã¯ã€å°¤åº¦ï¼ˆç¢ºã‹ã‚‰ã—ã•ï¼‰ã‚’è¨ˆç®—ã—ã¦å…¶ã‚Œã«ï¼ˆãŠãŠã‚ˆãï¼‰å¾“ã„æ–°ãŸã«ç²’å­ã‚’æ’’ããªãŠã—ã¾ã™ï¼ˆã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã•ã›ã¾ã™ï¼‰â†’ã£ã¦ã‹ã‚“ã˜ã§å¯¾è±¡ã®å‹•ãã‚’æ¨å®šã—ã¦ãã‚Œã¾ã™

ãªã‚“ã§ã„ããªã‚Šãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¯ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ«ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã®è©±ã‚’ã—ãŸã‹ã¨ã„ã†ã¨ã€ã“ã„ã¤ã¯ç”»åƒè§£æã®åˆ†é‡ã§ã¯ãƒã‚¤ã‚ºã‚„äºˆæƒ³å¤–ã®å‹•ãã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦å½±éŸ¿ã‚’å—ã‘ã«ããã€ã—ã£ã‹ã‚Šã¨æ¨™çš„ã®ã‚‚ã®ã‚’è¿½ã£ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã‹ãªã‚Šæœ‰ç”¨ãªæ–¹æ³•ã‚‰ã—ã„ã‹ã‚‰ã§ã™ã€‚

ã¾ã‚ã¨ã‚Šã‚ãˆãšã‚„ã£ã¦ã¿ã‚ˆã†ã€‚ ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã§python3+opencvã‚’ã¤ã‹ã„ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ Opencvã‚’pythonã§ä½¿ãˆã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã£ãŸã®ã¯çµæ§‹æœ€è¿‘ãªã®ã§ã€ãªã‹ãªã‹è‰¯ã„æœ¬ãŒãªã„ã®ã§ã™ãŒã€å…¬å¼ã®ãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒªã‚¢ãƒ«ãŒçµæ§‹å½¹ã«ç«‹ã¡ã¾ã™ã€‚ http://labs.eecs.tottori-u.ac.jp/sd/Member/oyamada/OpenCV/html/py_tutorials/py_tutorials.html ã§ã‚‚ã€ã‚„ã£ã¦ãŸã‚‰çµæ§‹é–“é•ã„ã‚‚ã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€æ³¨æ„ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ ã‚ã¨ã€æœ‰æ–™ã§ã™ãŒUdemyã§ã‚‚opencv+pythonã®è¬›åº§ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€è©¦ã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ã‚‚è‰¯ã„ã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ å…ˆã»ã©ç´¹ä»‹ã—ãŸã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ”ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ’ã‚™ã‚·ã‚™ãƒ§ãƒ³æœ€å…ˆç«¯ã‚«ã‚™ã‚¤ãƒˆã‚™ã‚‚ç†è«–ãŒã‚ã‹ã‚‰ãªã„æ™‚ä¾¿åˆ©ã§ã™ã€‚

ã†ã¾ãã„ã£ãŸä¾‹ã¯ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã«å¤§é‡ã«ã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€èˆˆå‘³ã®ã‚ã‚‹æ–¹ã¯æ¤œç´¢ã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

ã¡ãªã¿ã«ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¯ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ«ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã§ã®ä¸€ç•ªã®è‚ã¯ã€â†‘ã®4ï¼å°¤åº¦é–¢æ•°ã®è¨­å®šã®ä»•æ–¹ã§ã™ã€‚ ä»Šå›ã¯è‰²ã®å°¤åº¦ã®ä»–ã«ã€è·é›¢ã§ã‚‚å°¤åº¦ã‚’è¨­å®šã—ã¦ï¼ˆã¤ã¾ã‚Šã‚ã‚‹æ™‚ç‚¹ã§æ•£ã‚‰ã°ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ç²’å­ã®é‡å¿ƒã‹ã‚‰ã®è·é›¢ã‚’è€ƒãˆã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ï¼‰ãã‚Œã‚‰ã‚’ã‹ã‘ãŸã‚‚ã®ã‚’æœ€çµ‚ã®å°¤åº¦ã®ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚¦ãƒ³é‹å‹•ã§ã¯ãªãã€ä»Šå›ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ç´°èƒã®å‹•ãã‚’è¿½ã†å ´åˆã§ã¯ã€æ¬¡ã®ãƒ•ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ ã§å‹•ããã†ãªã¨ã“ã‚ã®å°¤åº¦ã‚’å¤§ããã™ã‚Œã°ã‚‚ã£ã¨æ­£ç¢ºã«å‹•ãã‚’è¿½ã„ã‹ã‘ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã¿ãŸã„ã§ã™ã€‚ é›£ã—ã„ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ ã¹ã‚“ãã‚‡ã†ã—ãŸã„ã§ã™ã­ãƒ¼

ä»¥ä¸Šã§ã™ ä»¥ä¸‹ã€ã€ŒUdemy ã€Pythonã§å­¦ã¶ã€‘OpenCVã§ã®ç”»åƒå‡¦ç†å…¥é–€ã€ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’å‚è€ƒã«ã•ã›ã¦ã„ãŸã ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

[code lang="text"] import cv2 import numpy as np import os import sys import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from tqdm import tqdm import time

for i in tqdm(range(100)): time.sleep(0.1) #ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ã®è¡¨ç¤º

args = sys.argv #ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³å¼•æ•°

cap = cv2.VideoCapture("/movie/lps.avi") if cap.isOpened() == False: sys.exit

ret,frame = cap.read() h, w =frame.shape[:2]#å¤§ãã•ã‚’å–å¾—

fourcc = cv2.VideoWriter_fourcc(*"mp4v") output_dst = cv2.VideoWriter("/output/test[{0},{1}].m4v".format(args[1],args[2]),fourcc,5.0,(w,h))#å‹•ç”»å‡ºåŠ›ã®è¨­å®š

np.random.seed(100)#ä¹±æ•°ã®åˆæœŸåŒ–,æ¯å›åŒã˜ä¹±æ•°ã«ãªã‚‹ Np = 50#ç²’å­ã®æ•° obj = [int(float(args[1])),int(args[2])] #ç›®çš„ã®ï¼ˆè¿½ã„ã‹ã‘ã‚‹ï¼‰æ¨™çš„ã®åº§æ¨™0~512 WD = 100

px = np.zeros((Np),dtype=np.int64)#ç²’å­ã®xåº§æ¨™ py = np.zeros((Np),dtype=np.int64)#ç²’å­ã®yåº§æ¨™ lc = np.zeros((Np))#ç²’å­ã®è‰²ã®å°¤åº¦ ls = np.zeros((Np))#ç²’å­ã®ç©ºé–“ã®å°¤åº¦ lt = np.zeros((Np))#ç²’å­ã®å°¤åº¦total index = np.arange(Np)

objã®å‘¨ã‚Šã«æ’’ã

d = 10 px = np.random.normal(obj[0], d, Np).astype(np.int) py = np.random.normal(obj[1], d, Np).astype(np.int)

j = 0 artists = [] while True: ret, frame = cap.read()#ï¼‘æšèª­ã¿è¾¼ã¿ if ret == False: break#æœ€å¾Œã«ãªã£ãŸã‚‰ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã‹ã‚‰æŠœã‘ã‚‹

gx = np.average(px) gy = np.average(py)#ï¼‘ãƒ•ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ å‰ã®ç²’å­ã®é‡å¿ƒ

for i in range(Np): lc[i] = frame[py[i],px[i]][1] / 255.0#è‰²ã®å°¤åº¦ ls[i] = np.exp(-((px[i] - gx) 2 + (py[i] - gy) 2)/(WD ** 2)) lt[i] = lc[i] * ls[i] lt = lt / lt.sum()

pnew_index = np.array(random.choices(population=index,weights=lt,k=Np)) pxnew = px[pnew_index] + np.random.randint(-15,15,Np) pynew = py[pnew_index] + np.random.randint(-15,15,Np)

plt.hist(lt)

ãƒªã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã—ãŸ,ã‚ã‚‹ç¨‹åº¦ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯

px = np.where(pxnew > w-1, w-1, pxnew) py = np.where(pynew > h-1, h-1, pynew) px = np.where(px < 0, 0, px) py = np.where(py < 0, 0, py)#ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã§ç”»é¢å¤–ã«å‡ºã‚‹å ´åˆã®å‡¦ç† for i in range(Np):#ç”»åƒã®ä¸­ã«ç²’å­ã‚’æã cv2.circle(frame,(px[i],py[i]),1,(255,255,255),1)

cv2.imwrite("/output/test_tiff/test" + str(j) + ".tif" ,frame) #tiffã§ã‚‚ä¿å­˜ j = j + 1

output_dst.write(frame) [/code]

ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã§ã™ã€‚

ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ãƒ¼

æœ€åˆã¯å°¤åº¦ã‚’è¨ˆç®—ã™ã‚‹ã¨ãä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ã‚„ã£ã¦ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ ''' pxnew = np.array(random.choices(population=px,weights=lt,k=Np)) + np.random.randint(-15,15,Np) pynew = np.array(random.choices(population=py,weights=lt,k=Np)) + np.random.randint(-15,15,Np) '''

ã“ã‚Œã§ã¯xã¨yã‚’åˆ¥ã€…ã«è¨ˆç®—ã—ã¦ã—ã¾ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€å¾®å¦™ã«çµæœãŒãŠã‹ã—ã„æ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã£ã¦ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ï¼ˆç‚¹ãŒå››è§’ã£ã½ããªã‚‹ï¼‰ ç¢ºã‹ã«ãã‚Œã¯ãã†ã‹ã€‚ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ ã«é¸ã¶ã®ã¯ï¼‘å›ã§ã„ã„ã¯ãšã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚

ã“ã†ã„ã†ã¨ãã€é©å½“ã«indexã¨ã‹ãŠã„ã¦ã‚„ã‚‹ã¨ã†ã¾ãã„ãã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚ ä»Šå›ã‚‚pnew_indexã‚’ãŠã„ã¦ã—ã¾ã†ã¨ã„ã†æ„Ÿã˜ã§ã‚„ã£ã¦ã¾ã™ã€‚

pnew_index = np.array(random.choices(population=index,weights=lt,k=Np)) pxnew = px[pnew_index] + np.random.randint(-15,15,Np) pynew = py[pnew_index] + np.random.randint(-15,15,Np)

entry.title: Pythonã®å¤‰æ•°ã¨ä»£å…¥ã«ã¤ã„ã¦
entry.content:
Pythonã®å¤‰æ•°ã€ãµã ã‚“ä½•æ°—ãªãä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€ã‚„ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯å®Ÿã¯çµæ§‹è¤‡é›‘ã§ã™ã€‚ä¸»ã«C/C++ã¨å¯¾æ¯”ã—ã¤ã¤ç°¡å˜ã«ã¾ã¨ã‚ã¦ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚

å®Ÿéš›ã®ã¨ã“ã‚ã€ã‚ˆãçŸ¥ã‚‰ãªãã¦ã‚‚ã‚ã¾ã‚Šå½±éŸ¿ãŒãªã„å ´åˆãŒæ®†ã©ã§ã™ã€‚ãŒã€è¤‡é›‘ãªæ“ä½œã‚’è¡Œã£ãŸã‚Šä½•ã‹å¤‰æ•°ã®æŒ™å‹•ãŒä¸å¯©ãªå ´åˆãªã©ã¯ã€æ€ã„å‡ºã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã®ã‚‚ã‚ˆã•ãã†ã§ã™ã€‚

å¤‰æ•°ã¯å‚ç…§ã§ã‚ã‚‹

ä¸€è¨€ã§ã„ãˆã°è¡¨é¡Œã®é€šã‚Šã€‚ Pythonã§ã®å¤‰æ•°ã¸ã®ä»£å…¥ã¨ã¯ã€å¤‰æ•°ã®å‚ç…§ã™ã‚‹ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªï¼ˆã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹ï¼‰ã‚’åˆ‡ã‚Šæ›¿ãˆã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã‚ã‚Šã€ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªã®å†…å®¹ã‚’æ›¸ãæ›ãˆã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã¯ãªã„ã€‚ã“ã‚ŒãŒå¤šãã®è¨€èªï¼ˆC/C++ãªã©ï¼‰ã¨å¤§ããé•ã†ã¨ã“ã‚ã§ã™ã€‚

å¤‰æ•°ã®ä»£å…¥(1)

ä¾‹ãˆã°ã“ã‚“ãªã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã€‚

# Python3
a = 0
a = 1
print(a)  # 1ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›

C++ã§æ›¸ãæ›ãˆã‚‹ã¨ã€

// C++
int a = 0;
a = 1;
cout << a << endl;  // 1ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›

ãªã®ã‹ï¼Ÿï¼Ÿ ï¼ˆ#include\ã¨ã‹int main(void){...}ã¨ã‹ã¯å…¨éƒ¨çœç•¥ã€‚ï¼‰

å®Ÿã¯é•ã†ã®ã§ã™ã€‚
C++ã®æ–¹ã§ã¯aã§è¡¨ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªé ˜åŸŸã‚’ä¸€ã¤ç¢ºä¿ã—ã€ãã“ã«ã¾ãš0ã‚’ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã€æ¬¡ã«1ã‚’ã€åŒã˜ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªé ˜åŸŸã‚’æ›¸ãæ›ãˆã¦ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

Pythonã®æ–¹ã¯ãã†ã§ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ã¾ãš0ã®å€¤ã‚’æŒã¤ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªé ˜åŸŸã‚’ç¢ºä¿ã—ã€å¤‰æ•°aãŒãã“ã‚’æŒ‡ã™ã‚ˆã†ã«ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚æ¬¡ã«1ã®å€¤ã‚’æŒã¤åˆ¥ã®ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªé ˜åŸŸã‚’ç¢ºä¿ã—ã€å¤‰æ•°aãŒãã“ã‚’æŒ‡ã™ã‚ˆã†ã«åˆ‡ã‚Šæ›¿ãˆã¾ã™ã€‚

C++ã§ç„¡ç†çŸ¢ç†ãã‚Œã£ã½ã„ã‚‚ã®ã‚’æ›¸ãã¨ã€

// C++
int *a = new int(0);
a = new int(1);

mo = phone_num_regex.search('ç§ã®é›»è©±ç•ªå·ã¯080-1111-22222ã§ã™ã€‚')

from sklearn import datasets
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
digits = datasets.fetch_mldata(â€˜MNIST originalâ€™)

import umap
embedding = umap.UMAP().fit_transform(digits.data)
plt.figure(figsize=(12,8))
plt.scatter(embedding[:,0],embedding[:,1],c=digits.target, s=0.1)

entry.title: Juliaã¨Pythonã¨ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°
entry.content:
æœ€è¿‘å‹äººã¨è©±ã—ã¦ã„ã¦Julia (https://julialang.org)ãŒè©±é¡Œã«ãªã£ãŸã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã£ãŸã®ã§ã€å°‘ã—ã ã‘èª¿ã¹ã¦è©¦ã—ã¦ã¿ãŸè©±ã€‚

Juliaã£ã¦ãªã«ï¼Ÿ

Pythonã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‹•çš„å‹ä»˜ã‘ã®ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆè¨€èªã§ã™ã€‚å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚ã«ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è¡Œã„Cè¨€èªã«ã‚‚è¿«ã‚‹å®Ÿè¡Œé€Ÿåº¦ã€ç§‘å­¦æŠ€è¡“ç³»ã®æ•°å€¤è¨ˆç®—ã‚‚ã©ã‚“ã¨æ¥ã„ã€ã¨ã„ã†è§¦ã‚Œè¾¼ã¿ã§ã€äººæ°—ä¸Šæ˜‡ä¸­ã‚‰ã—ã„ã§ã™ã€‚Pythonã‚’å«ã‚€ä»–è¨€èªã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã‚’èª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚€ä»•çµ„ã¿ã‚’å‚™ãˆã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã‚‚ã™ã”ã„ã¨ã“ã‚ã€‚
~~ãŸã ã€ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®è¦‹ãŸç›®ãŒæ¿€ã—ãMatlabé¢¨å‘³ã§æ€ã‚ãšç›®ã‚’èƒŒã‘ãŸããªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚~~

AtCoderã§ã®Julia

ã”å¤šåˆ†ã«æ¼ã‚Œãšã€å®Ÿè¡Œé€Ÿåº¦ã«æƒ¹ã‹ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚åŠå¹´ã»ã©å‰ã‹ã‚‰å‚åŠ ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ç«¶æŠ€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆAtCoder (https://atcoder.jp)ã§ã€å¸¸ç”¨ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹Pythonï¼ˆâ† Pythonä¼šã ã‹ã‚‰ã­ï¼ï¼‰ã§å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚é–“åˆ‡ã‚Œã€C/C++ã«æ›¸ãæ›ãˆã‚‹ã¨æ­£ç­”ã€ã¨ã„ã†çµŒé¨“ã‚’ä½•åº¦ã‹ã—ã¦ããŸã®ã§ã€‚

ãã†ã„ã†ã‚ã‘ã§ã€ã“ã“ã§ã¯æœ€è¿‘ã®ç¬¬121å› AtCoder Beginner Contest (ABC121) (https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc121/)ã®å•é¡Œã§ã€Juliaã®ãƒ‘ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚’å®Ÿéš›ã«è¦‹ã¦ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚
ï¼ˆè¨€èªçŸ¥è­˜0ã‹ã‚‰æ•°ååˆ†èª¿ã¹ã¦æ›¸ã„ãŸã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®ãŸã‚ã€å‹•ãã¯ã™ã‚‹ãŒæ€ã‚ã¬ã¨ã“ã‚ã§éåŠ¹ç‡ã€ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã¯ã‚ã‚‹ã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ï¼‰

AtCoder Beginner Contest 121 å•é¡ŒA "White Cells"

ï¼ˆå•é¡Œã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ â†’ https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc121/tasks/abc121_aï¼‰

å…¥åŠ›å€¤4å€‹ã‚’èª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã§ç°¡å˜ãªæ¼”ç®—çµæœã‚’è¿”ã™ã ã‘ã®å•é¡Œã§ã™ã€‚

# ABC121-A "White Cells" in Julia
inpl() = map(parse,split(readline()))
(H,W) = inpl()
(h,w) = inpl()
println((H-h)*(W-w))

æ‰€è¦æ™‚é–“ãŒå…¥åŠ›ã«ã»ã¼ä¾å­˜ã—ãªã„å•é¡Œã§ã™ãŒã€ã€å„è¨€èªã§ã®AtCoderä¸Šå®Ÿè¡Œçµæœã€‚

è¨€èª å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚é–“ æ¶ˆè²»ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒª
Julia 360 ms 110 MB
PyPy3 180 ms 40 MB
Python3 17 ms 3 MB
C++ 1 ms 256 kB

C++ã«ã‚‚Pythonã«ã‚‚ã€å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚é–“ã¨æ¶ˆè²»ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªåŒæ–¹ã§æƒ¨æ•—ã€‚
ãŠãã‚‰ãã§ã™ãŒã€å®Ÿè¡Œã”ã¨ã«ã¾ãšã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è¡Œã†ã®ã§ã€ç°¡å˜ãªå•é¡Œã ã¨ãã‚ŒãŒç›¸å¯¾çš„ã«å·¨å¤§ãªã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ‰ã«ãªã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã†ã‚ˆã†ã§ã™ã€‚
Pythonã®åŠã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ©å‹å®Ÿè£…ã§ã‚ã‚‹PyPyã¯Juliaã®åŠåˆ†ç¨‹åº¦ã§ã—ãŸã€‚

AtCoder Beginner Contest 121 å•é¡ŒC "Energy Drink Collector"

ï¼ˆå•é¡Œã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ â†’ https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc121/tasks/abc121_cï¼‰

èª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã å€¤ã®åˆ—ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã€æ¡ä»¶åˆ¤å®šã‚’ã—ãªãŒã‚‰é †ç•ªã«è¶³ã—ä¸Šã’ã¦ã„ãå•é¡Œã€‚

# ABC121-C "Energy Drink Collector" in Julia
inpl() = map(parse,split(readline()))
(N,M) = inpl()
A = Array{Int}(N,2)
for i in 1:N
  A[i,:] = inpl()
end
A = sortrows(A, by=x->x[1])
ans = 0
for i in 1:N
  if A[i,2] >= M
    ans += M*A[i,1]
    break
  else
    M -= A[i,2]
    ans += A[i,1]*A[i,2]
  end
end
println(ans)

ãªã‚“ã¨ã€ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆ16å€‹ä¸­15å€‹ã§ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¢ã‚¦ãƒˆï¼ˆ2000msä»¥ä¸Šï¼‰ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚

Pythonã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ï¼š

# ABC121-C "Energy Drink Collector" in Python3
inpl = lambda: list(map(int,input().split()))
N,M = inpl()
A = []
for i in range(N):
  A.append(inpl())
A.sort(key=lambda x: x[0])
ans = 0
for i in range(N):
  if A[i][1] >= M:
    ans += A[i][0]*M
    break
  else:
    M -= A[i][1]
    ans += A[i][0]*A[i][1]
print(ans)

<style type="text/css">/*!
*
* IPython notebook
*
*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI escape sequences */
/* The color values are a mix of
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/baskerville-ivorylight and
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/euphrasia */
.ansi-black-fg {
  color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-bg {
  background-color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-intense-fg {

}
.ansi-black-intense-bg {

}

}

.ansi-bold {

.ansi-underline {

}
/* The following styles are deprecated an will be removed in a future version */
.ansibold {

}
.ansi-inverse {

}
/* use dark versions for foreground, to improve visibility */
.ansiblack {
  color: black;
}

}

/* and light for background, for the same reason */

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}
/*

Original style from softwaremaniacs.org (c) Ivan Sagalaev <Maniac@SoftwareManiacs.Org>
Adapted from GitHub theme

*/
.highlight-base {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable-2 {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
.highlight-variable-3 {
  color: #333333;
}

}

  font-weight: bold;
}

}

  font-weight: bold;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-variable-2 {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-variable-3 {
  color: #333333;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-comment {
  color: #408080;
  font-style: italic;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-string {
  color: #BA2121;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-string-2 {
  color: #f50;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-meta {
  color: #AA22FF;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-qualifier {
  color: #555;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-builtin {
  color: #008000;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-bracket {
  color: #997;

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */

}

}

/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after

div.output_subarea {

/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different

ã¨ã“ã‚ã§ã€y = x ã®ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã«æ¯”ã¹ã¦ã€ä¸‹ã®æ–¹ã‚’ä¼ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‹ã‚‹ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
ã“ã‚Œã“ããŒã€å¹´åã®åˆ†å¸ƒã«ä¸å‡ä¸€æ€§ãŒå­˜åœ¨ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚</p>
<p>ä¾‹ãˆã°ã€(å¹³å‡å¹´å*ä¸–å¸¯æ•°)ã®ç´¯ç©ç›¸å¯¾åº¦æ•° = 20%ã®ã¨ã“ã‚ã§ã€ã ã„ãŸã„ã€ä¸–å¸¯æ•°ç´¯ç©åº¦ = 50%ã¨ãªã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã­ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯ã€æ—¥æœ¬äººã®å¹´åã®åˆè¨ˆ20%ã‚’å¹´åã®ä½ã„50%ã®äººãŒå—ã‘å–ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†æ„å‘³ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚</p>
<p>ã¾ãŸã€å¹³å‡å¹´å*ä¸–å¸¯æ•°)ã®ç´¯ç©ç›¸å¯¾åº¦æ•° = 40%ã€ä¸–å¸¯æ•°ç´¯ç©åº¦ = 80%ã¨ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã­ã€ã“ã‚Œã¯é«˜ç´šã©ã‚Šä¸Šä½20%ã®äººãŒã€æ—¥æœ¬äººã®å¹´ååˆè¨ˆã®60%ã‚’æ‰€æœ‰ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã†ãƒ¼ã‚“ã€å¹´åã®ä¸å‡ç­‰ã¯ç¢ºã‹ã«å­˜åœ¨ã—ã¦ã„ãã†ã§ã™ã­ã€‚</p>

entry.title: VELOCYTO
entry.content:
Velocyto ã¨ã¯ã€RNAseq ã®çµæœã«å«ã¾ã‚Œã‚‹ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ­ãƒ³ã®å‰²åˆã‹ã‚‰ãã®ç´°èƒã®åˆ†åŒ–æŒ‡å‘æ€§ã‚’ç®—å‡ºã™ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†è§£ææ‰‹æ³•ã§ã™ã€‚

RNAseq ã§ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ­ãƒ³??

RNAseq ã«ãŠã„ã¦ã¯ totalRNA ã®ã†ã¡ 99%ã¨ã‚‚ã„ã‚ã‚Œã‚‹ rRNA ã‚’é™¤ã mRNA ã®ã¿ã‚’åŠ¹ç‡ã‚ˆãSequence ã™ã‚‹ç›®çš„ã§ã€Poly(A)ã§æˆç†Ÿ mRNA ã‚’æ¿ƒç¸®ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã—ã°ã—ã°è¡Œã‚ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã—ã‹ã—ã€ãã®ã‚ˆã†ãªã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã«ãŠã„ã¦ã‚‚ã€å®Ÿéš›ã® Sequence çµæœã§ã¯ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ­ãƒ³ã«ã‚ãŸã‚‹é…åˆ—ãŒèª­ã¾ã‚Œã¦ãã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒæŒ‡æ‘˜ã•ã‚Œã¦ãŠã‚Šã€ã“ã®åŸå› ã¯ Poly(A)é¡ä¼¼ãƒ¢ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ•ã®å­˜åœ¨ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã¨æ¨å¯Ÿã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

çµæœã®ä¾‹

æ¦‚æ—¥æ™‚é–“ã®æ¤œè¨ã§ã¯ã¨ã¦ã‚‚ãã‚Œã„ãªçµæœãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚é–¢é€£éºä¼å­ã®unspliced(u) ã¨spliced(s)ã‚’è¦³å¯Ÿã—ã¦ã„ãã¨ã€circadian timeã®çµŒéã¨ã¨ã‚‚ã«u ãŒs ã«å¤‰åŒ–ã—ã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚

ã¾ãŸã€æœªåˆ†åŒ–ç´°èƒã‹ã‚‰ã®åˆ†åŒ–ã®æ–¹å‘æ€§ã‚’è¦‹ç©ã‚‚ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚å¯èƒ½ã¨å ±å‘Šã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒã‚¦ã‚¹ã®ã‚ªãƒªã‚´ãƒ‡ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ­ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆå‰é§†ä½“ç´°èƒãŒã‚ªãƒªã‚´ãƒ‡ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ­ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã¸åˆ†åŒ–ã™ã‚‹æ–¹å‘ã« Velocityã‚’æŒã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒç¤ºã•ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

å®Ÿè·µç·¨

ã‚“ã¨ã€ã€ã€ã¾ãšã€ã“ã®æ•°å­—ã¯ååˆ†ã«æœ‰æ„ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã¨ã„ãˆã¾ã™ï¼ˆï½·ï¾˜ï½¯ï¼‰ã€‚
ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ ã«æŒ‡ã™ã®ã¨æ¯”ã¹ã¦ã€ç¢ºå®Ÿã«å¼·ã„ã§ã™ã€‚
ã—ã‹ã—ã€ã€ã“ã®ç¨‹åº¦ã§ã¯ã€ã¾ã äººé–“ã¨å‹è² ã§ãã‚‹ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ«ã§ãªã„ã“ã¨ã‚‚æ˜ã‚‰ã‹ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã€‚

åŸå› ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã¯ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯è¨­è¨ˆã«å•é¡ŒãŒã‚ã‚‹å¯èƒ½æ€§ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ãŒã€ãŠãã‚‰ãå­¦ç¿’é‡ãŒå…¨ç„¶è¶³ã‚Šãªã„ã®ã ã¨æ€ã‚ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚
å¼·åŒ–å­¦ç¿’ã®æˆé•·ã¯ã‚†ã£ãã‚Šã§ã€å°‘ã—ã¥ã¤é«˜åº¦ãªå¥½æ‰‹ã‚’é †ç•ªã«è¦‹å‡ºã—ã¦ã„ãå¿…è¦ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

ä¾‹ãˆã°ã¾ãšæœ€åˆã«ã€ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ªãƒ³ãŒå–ã‚Œã‚‹ã¨ãã¯å–ã‚‹ã®ãŒå¥½æ‰‹ã ã€ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã‚’å­¦ã¶ã€‚ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€é§’ãŒå¤šã„ã¨ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ªãƒ³ã‚’å–ã‚Œã‚‹æ©Ÿä¼šã‚‚å¢—ãˆã‚‹ã®ã§ã€é§’ã‚’å–ã‚‹ã®ãŒã„ã„ã“ã¨ã‚’å­¦ã¶ã€‚å¤šåˆ†ã¾ã ã€æœ€åˆã®æ®µéšã®é€”ä¸­ãã‚‰ã„ã¨æƒ³åƒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚
ãã†ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã‚’è€ƒãˆã‚‹ã¨ã€130ä¸‡å±€é¢ã‚’è©•ä¾¡ã—ãŸæ®µéšã§ã®å‹ç‡53%ã¯ã€ãã‚Œãªã‚Šã«ç´å¾—ã§ãã‚‹æ•°å­—ã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚

ä»Šå›ã¯ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆPCä¸Šã§1æ™‚é–“è¶³ã‚‰ãšã®å­¦ç¿’ãªã®ã§ã€ã¾ãŸæ™‚é–“ãŒã§ããŸã‚‰ã‚‚ã£ã¨å¤§è¦æ¨¡ã«ã‚„ã£ã¦ã¿ãŸã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ è‡ªå·±å¯¾æˆ¦éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’Cythonã§é«˜é€ŸåŒ–ã—ã¦ã€GPUã‚µãƒ¼ãƒä¸Šã§å­¦ç¿’ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã‹ã€‚

ã²ã¨ã¾ãšä»Šå›ã¯ã“ã“ã¾ã§ã€‚ãŠã—ã¾ã„ã€‚

è¿½è¨˜1

å¼·åŒ–å­¦ç¿’ã‚’ã•ã‚‰ã«2å€ã€ç·è¨ˆ218å±€ã®è‡ªå·±å¯¾æˆ¦ã¾ã§è¡Œã‚ã›ãŸã¨ã“ã‚ã€åˆæ³•æ‰‹ç‡86.0%ã€å­¦ç¿’å‰ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã«å¯¾ã™ã‚‹å‹ç‡51.7%ã¾ã§ãã‚Œãã‚Œæš´è½ã€‚ä½•ãŒèµ·ã“ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã‹ã€ã‚„ã£ã±ã‚Šã‚ˆãã‚ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚å­¦ç¿’æ–¹æ³•ã‚’ã‚‚ã†å°‘ã—æ¤œè¨ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã‹ã€ã‚ã¨ã¯ã‚„ã¯ã‚Šã‚‚ã£ã¨è¨ˆç®—è³‡æºã‚’æŠ•å…¥ã™ã‚‹å¿…è¦ã¯ã‚ã‚Šãã†ã§ã™ã‹ã­ã€‚

è¿½è¨˜2

å¼·åŒ–å­¦ç¿’ã®æ–¹æ³•ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã§ã™ãŒã€ç¢ã¨å°†æ£‹ã®é•ã„ã¨ã—ã¦ã€ç‰¹ã«æ£‹åŠ›ãŒä½ã„å ´åˆã€å°†æ£‹ã§ã¯çµ‚ç›¤ï¼ˆçµ‚å±€é–“éš›ï¼‰ã®æŒ‡ã—æ‰‹ãŒå‹æ•—ã«åœ§å€’çš„ã«é‡è¦ã€ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚
ä»Šã®å ´åˆã€æœ€åˆã¯ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ªãƒ³å–ã‚Šã‚’å­¦ã¶ã“ã¨ãŒå¿…è¦ãªã®ã§ã™ãŒã€æœ€å¾Œã«ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ªãƒ³ã‚’å–ã‚‹ã¾ã§ã«ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ªãƒ³å–ã‚Šã‚’è¦‹é€ƒã—ãŸæ‰‹ãªã©ã‚‚æ•™å¸«ä¿¡å·ã«ãªã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
æœ€åˆã¯æœ€çµ‚æ‰‹ã ã‘å­¦ã¶ãªã©ã¨äººç‚ºçš„ã«é‡ã¿ã‚’ã„ã˜ã£ãŸæ–¹ãŒã€ä»Šã®ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ«ã§ã¯è‰¯ã„çµæœãŒå‡ºã‚‹ã‹ã‚‚ã€‚ç‹é“ã¯ã€ãƒã‚·ãƒ³ãƒ‘ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã®åŠ›å°½ããªã®ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ãŒã€‚ã€‚

entry.title: ã‚«ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼æ›²ç·šã«ã¤ã„ã¦
entry.content:
ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«

æ›¸ã“ã†ã¨æ€ã£ãŸãã£ã‹ã‘

å®Ÿç¿’ä¸­è«–æ–‡ã‚’é ‚ã„ã¦èª­ã‚€æ©Ÿä¼šãŒå¤šã„ãŒã€åŒ»å­¦è«–æ–‡ã¯è–¬ã¯æ–°ã—ã„æ²»ç™‚æ–¹æ³•ã®æˆç¸¾ã‚’æ¯”è¼ƒã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ãŒå¤šã„ã€‚ ã ã„ãŸã„ Kaplan-Meieræ›²ç·š ãŒä½¿ã‚ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã§(åè¦‹)ã€è«–æ–‡ã‚’èª­ã‚€ã¨ãã«ã¯ã‚‚ã¡ã‚ã‚“ã€å°†æ¥è‡ªåˆ†ãŒè«–æ–‡ã‚’åŸ·ç­†ã™ã‚‹ã¨ãã«ã€ä½•ãŒè¡Œã‚ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã‹å°‘ã—ã§ã‚‚ç†è§£ã§ãã¦ã„ã‚Œã°ã„ã„ã‹ãªã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã¨ã‚ã¦ã¿ãŸã€‚

Kaplan-Meier æ›²ç·šã¨ã¯

Wikipediaã«ã‚ˆã‚‹ã¨ã€Œæ²»ç™‚ã‚’è¡Œã£ãŸå¾Œã®æ‚£è€…ã®ç”Ÿå­˜ç‡ã‚’ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã«ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®ã€ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ãŸã ã€å®Ÿéš›ã«ã¯å•é¡ŒãŒã„ãã¤ã‹ã‚ã£ã¦

  • è¦³å¯ŸæœŸé–“ã¯é™ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹(æ‚£è€…ã•ã‚“ã‚’ä½•å¹´ã‚‚ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯ã§ããªã„)
  • è¦³å¯Ÿä¸èƒ½ã«ãªã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚‹(ç—…é™¢ç§»ã£ãŸã€ä»–ã®è¦å› ã§æ­»äº¡ã—ãŸãªã©)
  • æ‚£è€…ã•ã‚“ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦è¦³å¯Ÿé–‹å§‹æ™‚é–“ã¯æ§˜ã€…(ã¿ã‚“ãªä¸€ç·’ã«ç½¹æ‚£ã—ãŸã‚Šæ²»ç™‚ã‚’é–‹å§‹ã™ã‚‹ã‚ã‘ã§ã¯ãªã„) ãã†ã„ã£ãŸå•é¡Œã‚’ã†ã¾ãå¯¾å‡¦ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã®ãŒKaplan-Meieræ›²ç·šã€‚

Kaplan-Meieræ›²ç·šã®ç¸¦è»¸ã¯ç´¯ç©ç”Ÿå­˜ç‡ã§ã€

$$ S(t)=\prod_j^t \left(1-\frac{d_j}{n_j}\right) $$

ã§è¡¨ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã“ã§\(d_j\)ã¯æ™‚é–“\(j\)ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹æ­»äº¡è€…æ•°ã§ã€\(n_j\)ã¯æ™‚é–“\(j\)ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ç”Ÿå­˜è€…æ•°ã§ã™ã€‚

ä»Šå›ã¯pythonã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã§Kaplan-Meieræ›²ç·šã‚’æ›¸ã„ã¦ã„ã“ã†ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ pythonã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã«lifelinesã¨ã„ã†ä¾¿åˆ©ãªãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ãã‚Œã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ã“ã†ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚installã¯pipã§ã§ãã¾ã™ï¼špip install lifelines

ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®æº–å‚™

ã‚ã‚‹ç—…æ°—ã«å¯¾ã™ã‚‹æ²»ç™‚æ³•ã®äºˆå¾Œã®Kaplan-Meieræ›²ç·šã‚’æããŸã„ã¨ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ ã‚ã‚‹æœŸé–“å†…ã«è¦³å¯Ÿã•ã‚ŒãŸæ‚£è€…ã®çµŒéã‚’ã¿ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚‹ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€æ‚£è€…ã•ã‚“ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦ç™ºç—‡ã™ã‚‹æ™‚é–“ã‚‚æ§˜ã€…ãªã®ã§ã€ã‚¤ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã¨ã—ã¦ä¸‹ã®å›³ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚‹ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from lifelines import KaplanMeierFitter
from lifelines.plotting import plot_lifetimes
from numpy.random import uniform, exponential
%matplotlib inline
%config InlineBackend.figure_format = 'retina'

N = 50
current_time = 48
birth = np.random.randint(0,45,50)
actual_lifetimes = np.array([[int(exponential(20))+1, int(exponential(10))+1][uniform() < 0.5] for i in range(N)])
observed_lifetimes = np.minimum((actual_lifetimes+birth), current_time)
observed = (birth + actual_lifetimes) < current_time

plt.xlim(0, 50)
plt.vlines(48, 0, 50, lw=2, linestyles='--',colors='red')
plt.xlabel("time")
plt.title("Births and deaths of our population, at $t=48$")
plot_lifetimes(observed_lifetimes-birth, event_observed=observed,birthtimes=birth)
print("Observed lifetimes at time %d:\n" % (current_time), observed_lifetimes)


Observed lifetimes at time 48:
 [48 47 27 48 48 40 34  3 46 41 40 48 30 48 40 46 48 34 48 48 15 36 38 31
 46 22 44 16 42 48 45 19 46 44 31 16 33  9 32 42 11 36 48 48 44 48 14 39
 37 45]

èµ¤ç·šã§ã¯æœŸé–“å†…(t=48)ã«æ‚£è€…ã•ã‚“ãŒæ­»äº¡ã—ãŸã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã€é’ç·šã¯è¦³æ¸¬ä¸èƒ½ã«ãªã£ãŸã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã§ã™(è¦³å¯ŸæœŸé–“çµ‚ã‚ã£ãŸã‹ã‚‰ãã‚Œä»¥ä¸Šè¿½ãˆãªã„)ã€‚

ç°¡å˜ã®ãŸã‚ã€è¦³æ¸¬ä¸èƒ½ã«ãªã£ãŸã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯è¦³æ¸¬æœŸé–“ãŒçµ‚ã‚ã£ãŸå ´åˆã®ã¿ã¨ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚è¦³å¯ŸæœŸé–“ã®é•·ã•ã§ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€ä¸‹ã®å›³ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

s = pd.Series(observed_lifetimes-birth,observed)
s = s.sort_values()
s.name = 'time'
observed, result_lifetimes = s.index, s.values

plt.xlim(0,50)
#plt.vlines(22, 0, 30, lw=2, linestyles='--',colors='red')
plt.xlabel("time")
plt.title("Births and deaths of our population, at $t=22$")
plot_lifetimes(result_lifetimes, event_observed=observed)

å®Ÿéš›ã®è¨ˆç®—

ã•ã£ãä½œã£ãŸãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã€ç´¯ç©ç”Ÿå­˜ç‡ã‚’è¨ˆç®—ã—ã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚ãŸã¨ãˆã°t=5ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ç´¯ç©ç”Ÿå­˜ç‡ã‚’è¨ˆç®—ã™ã‚‹ã¨ãã€

rueãŒæ‚£è€…ã•ã‚“ãŒæ­»äº¡ã—ãŸã®ã‚’è¦³æ¸¬ã§ããŸäº‹ä¾‹ã€FalseãŒè¦³å¯ŸæœŸé–“çµ‚äº†ã«ã‚ˆã‚Šè¦³æ¸¬ã§ããªã‹ã£ãŸäº‹ä¾‹ã§ã™ã€‚è¦³å¯ŸæœŸé–“ã®çŸ­ã„é †ã«è¦‹ã¦ã„ãã¨ã€

  • t=1ã®ã¨ãã€50äººã®ã†ã¡2äººãŒæ­»äº¡,1äººãŒæ‰“ã¡åˆ‡ã‚Šã€‚
  • t=2ã®ã¨ãã€æ­»äº¡è€…ã€æ‰“ã¡åˆ‡ã‚Šãªã—ã€‚
  • t=3ã®æ™‚ã¯ï¼”ï¼—äººã®ã†ã¡ï¼‘äººãŒæ­»äº¡ã€‚
  • t=4ã®æ™‚ã¯46äººã®ã†ã¡ï¼’äººãŒæ­»äº¡ã€ï¼’äººãŒæ‰“ã¡åˆ‡ã‚Šã€‚
  • t=5ã®æ™‚ã¯42äººä¸­ï¼‘äººæ­»äº¡ã€ï¼“äººãŒæ‰“ã¡åˆ‡ã‚Šã€‚

ã‚ˆã£ã¦\( S(5)\)ã¯

$$ S(5)=\left(1-\frac{1}{50}\right)\left(1-\frac{0}{47}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{47}\right)\left(1-\frac{2}{46}\right) \left(1-\frac{1}{42}\right) \simeq 0.896 $$

ã¨ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

çµæœã®ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆ

ã“ã“ã‚‰è¾ºã®è¨ˆç®—ã¨æç”»ã¯ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã«ä»»ã›ã¾ã™ã€‚

ã‚„ã£ã¦ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯å„æœŸé–“ã®ç‚¹ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ç´¯ç©ç”Ÿå­˜ç‡ã‚’ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆã—ã¦ç·šã‚’æ¨ªã«ä¼¸ã°ã™ã ã‘ã§ã™ã€‚

kmf = KaplanMeierFitter()
kmf.fit(result_lifetimes,event_observed=observed)
kmf.plot()
plt.title('Survival function of political regimes');

ä¹³ãŒã‚“ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦è§£æã‚’è¡Œã£ãŸä¾‹

ä¸€å¿œã“ã‚Œã§ç”Ÿå­˜æ›²ç·šã¯æã‘ãŸè¨³ã§ã™ãŒã€ã‚‚ã—æ²»ç™‚ã®æœ‰åŠ¹æ€§ã‚’ç¤ºã™ã®ã§ã‚ã‚Œã°ã€ä»–ã®æ²»ç™‚ç¾¤ã¨æ¯”è¼ƒã—ã¦ã€æœ‰åŠ¹æ€§ã‚’ç¤ºã•ãªã‘ã‚Œã°ã„ã‘ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚

ã“ã“ã‹ã‚‰ä½¿ã‚ã‚Œã‚‹çµ±è¨ˆæ‰‹æ³•ã¯Log-rankæ¤œå®šã€ä¸€èˆ¬åŒ–wilcoxonæ¤œå®šãªã©æ§˜ã€…ã§ã™ãŒã€ã“ã“ã§ã¯coxæ¯”ä¾‹ãƒã‚¶ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸå›å¸°åˆ†æã‚’ä¾‹ã«ã—ã¦è§£æã‚’é€²ã‚ã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚

coxæ¯”ä¾‹ãƒã‚¶ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã«é–¢ã™ã‚‹èª¬æ˜ã¯ã“ã®pdfãŒã‚ã‹ã‚Šã‚„ã™ã‹ã£ãŸã€‚

lifelinesãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã«ä¹³ãŒã‚“ã®äºˆå¾Œã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ãã‚Œã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ä¹³ãŒã‚“ã®æ²»ç™‚ã§ã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå› å­ãŒäºˆå¾Œã®ã«å½±éŸ¿ã‚’åŠã¼ã™ã®ã‹èª¿ã¹ã¦ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚

hormone therapyã®æœ‰ç„¡ã§2ç¾¤ã«åˆ†ã‘Kaplan-Meieræ›²ç·šã‚’æã„ãŸä¾‹

from lifelines.datasets import load_gbsg2
df = load_gbsg2()
ax = None
for name, group in df.groupby('horTh'):
    kmf = KaplanMeierFitter()
    kmf.fit(group['time'], event_observed=group['cens'],
            label = 'hormone therapy =' + str(name))
    # æç”»ã™ã‚‹ Axes ã‚’æŒ‡å®šã€‚None ã‚’æ¸¡ã™ã¨ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã«ãªã‚‹ã®ã§å ´åˆåˆ†ã‘
    if ax is None:
        ax = kmf.plot()
    else:
        ax = kmf.plot(ax=ax)
plt.title('Kaplan-Meier Curve')
plt.show()

Coxæ¯”ä¾‹ãƒã‚¶ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«(CoxPH model)ã®fitting

from lifelines import CoxPHFitter
cph = CoxPHFitter()
df = pd.get_dummies(df,columns=['horTh','menostat'],drop_first=True)
df.drop('tgrade',axis = 1,inplace = True)
cph.fit(df, duration_col='time', event_col='cens', show_progress=True)

Iteration 7: norm_delta = 0.00001, step_size = 0.95000, ll = -1740.65940, seconds_since_start = 0.1

ã¾ã¨ã‚

#!/bin/bash

sras=("SRR5385260" "SRR5385344" "SRR5385345" "SRR5385346" "SRR5385347")
for s in ${sras[@]};
do
pfastq-dump --threads 22 --outdir data ~/ncbi/public/sra/${s}.sra
done

make_bam.sh

#!/bin/bash

sras=("SRR5385260" "SRR5385344" "SRR5385345" "SRR5385346" "SRR5385347")
for s in ${sras[@]};
do
trimmomatic \
    SE                  \
    -threads 22         \
    -phred33            \
    -trimlog log.${s}.txt    \
    data/${s}.fastq            \
    data/${s}.trimmed.fastq          \
    ILLUMINACLIP:adapters.fa:2:10:10  \
    LEADING:20 \
    TRAILING:20 \
    MINLEN:30
bowtie2 -p 22 -x ~/ref_sequence/bowtie2_indexes/mm10 -U data/${s}.trimmed.fastq -S data/${s}.trimmed.sam >& data/out.${s}.txt
samtools sort -O bam -o data/${s}.trimmed.bam data/${s}.trimmed.sam
samtools index data/${s}.trimmed.bam data/${s}.trimmed.bai
done

ChIP-seqè§£æã®å®šç•ªãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã§ã‚ã‚‹MACS2ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã€‚èª¬æ˜ã¯å…¬å¼wikiãŒè©³ã—ã„ã€‚bigwigã¯peakcallã®å‰¯ç”£ç‰©çš„ãªæ‰±ã„ã§ã€ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³ã¯ChIP-seqã®ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã‚¯æƒ…å ±ã€‚bigwigã¯å°‘ã—å›ã‚Šãã©ã„ä½œã‚Šæ–¹ãŒå¿…è¦ã€‚è©³ã—ãã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã€‚

#!/bin/bash

# check commands: slopBed, bedGraphToBigWig and bedClip

which bedtools &>/dev/null || { echo "bedtools not found! Download bedTools: "; exit 1; }
which bedGraphToBigWig &>/dev/null || { echo "bedGraphToBigWig not found! Download: "; exit 1; }
which bedClip &>/dev/null || { echo "bedClip not found! Download: "; exit 1; }

# end of checking

if [ $# -lt 2 ];then
    echo "Need 2 parameters!  "
    exit
fi

F=$1
G=$2

bedtools slop -i ${F} -g ${G} -b 0 | bedClip stdin ${G} ${F}.clip

LC_COLLATE=C sort -k1,1 -k2,2n ${F}.clip > ${F}.sort.clip

bedGraphToBigWig ${F}.sort.clip ${G} ${F/bdg/bw}

rm -f ${F}.clip ${F}.sort.clip

$ macs2 callpeak -t ../data/SRR5385347.trimmed.bam -c ../data/SRR5385260.trimmed.bam -g mm -n Tconv_H3K27ac_2 -p 1e-5 -f BAM -B --nomodel >& macs.SRR5385347.out && bdg2bw Tconv_H3K27ac_2_treat_pileup.bdg ../chromInfo.txt

import pandas as pd
from sklearn import datasets
from scipy.cluster.hierarchy import dendrogram, linkage
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt

iris = datasets.load_iris() # data load
df = pd.DataFrame(iris.data, columns=iris.feature_names)

# ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ‰æ³• & ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ‰è·é›¢
linkage_result = linkage(df, method='ward', metric='euclidean')

fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10, 4))
dn = dendrogram(linkage_result, labels=list(iris.target_names[iris.target]),
                              above_threshold_color="grey")

# å„ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«ã«è‰²ã‚’å‰²ã‚Šå½“ã¦
label_colors = {'setosa': 'c', 'versicolor': 'm', 'virginica': 'y'}

ax = plt.gca()
xlbls = ax.get_xmajorticklabels()
for lbl in xlbls:
    lbl.set_color(label_colors[lbl.get_text()])
plt.title("Dendrogram of Iris dataset ")
plt.ylabel("Distance")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

çµæœ

ç¸¦è»¸ãŒã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã‚¿é–“è·é›¢ã§ã™ã€‚æ¨ªè»¸ã®ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«ã§ã¯ã€setosaã‚’ã‚·ã‚¢ãƒ³ã€versicolorã‚’ãƒã‚¼ãƒ³ã‚¿ã€virginicaã‚’é»„è‰²ã¨ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

setosaã¯ç¶ºéº—ã«åˆ†ã‹ã‚Œã¾ã™ãŒã€versicolorã¨virginicaã¯ã†ã¾ãåˆ†ã‘ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ãªã„ã®ãŒã‚ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ãªã‚‹ã»ã©ã€‚

Field Programmable Gate Arrayã®ç•¥ã€‚ãƒ‡ã‚¸ã‚¿ãƒ«å›è·¯ã‚’è‡ªåˆ†ã§è¨­è¨ˆã§ãã‚‹é›†ç©å›è·¯ã€‚é›†ç©å›è·¯ã¨ã„ãˆã°å˜ä¸€ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚’ä½é›»åŠ›ä½ã‚³ã‚¹ãƒˆã§é«˜é€Ÿãªæ¼”ç®—ãŒå¯èƒ½ã ãŒã€å°‚é–€å®¶ã—ã‹ä½œã‚Œãªã‹ã£ãŸã—ã€ãã‚‚ãã‚‚ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨è‡ªä½“ãŒå¤§å¤‰ã ã£ãŸã€‚FPGAã¯é›†ç©å›è·¯ã®è¨­è¨ˆã‚’ã‚½ãƒ•ãƒˆã§è¡Œã†ã“ã¨ã§ã€æŸ”è»Ÿã«å°‚é–€è¨­è¨ˆãŒå¯èƒ½ã«ãªã£ãŸã€‚ã¡ã£ã¡ã‚ƒã„ã®ã§çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿ã«ã‚‚å‘ã„ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚æœ€è¿‘Scienceã«ã®ã£ã¦è©±é¡Œã«ãªã£ãŸGohst Cytometryã‚‚FPGAä½¿ã£ã¦ã‚‹ãã†ãªã€‚ï¼ˆé˜ªå¤§ã€æ±å¤§ã€ç†ç ”AIPã®ã‚³ãƒ©ãƒœã€‚ä¸‹ã§æ›¸ãjetsonåŒ–ã‚‚è¦–é‡ã«å…¥ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ï¼‰æœ€è¿‘ã§ã¯å„ç¤¾ãŒFPGAã«å–ã‚Šçµ„ã¿ã ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚Tensorflowã‚‚å‹•ã‹ã›ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ãŸã ã—ã‚„ã¯ã‚Šå°‚é–€å¤–ã§ã¯ã¨ã£ã¤ãã«ãã„ã€‚ãƒ”ãƒ³ã‚­ãƒªã ãŒã‚„ã™ã„ã®ã§ï¼‘ä¸‡ï¼•åƒå††ãã‚‰ã„ã€‚è«–ç†å›è·¯è¨­è¨ˆãŒã‚‚ã¨ã‚ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã®ã§ã¶ã£ã¡ã‚ƒã‘ã‚ˆãã‚ã‹ã‚‰ã‚“ã€‚

  • Qiita : ãã‚ãã‚ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒãƒ¼ã‚‚FPGAã‚’è§¦ã£ã¦ã¿ã‚ˆã†ï¼
  • Science : Gohst Cytometry

jetson

NVIDIAçµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã€‚å®‰ä¾¡ã‹ã¤é«˜é€Ÿã§ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ–ãƒ«ãªGPUãŒä½¿ãˆã‚‹ã€‚NVIDIAè£½ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã§ã€Tensorflowã‚‚ä½¿ãˆã‚‹ã®ãŒå¬‰ã—ã„ã€‚å€¤æ®µã¯é–‹ç™ºã‚­ãƒƒãƒˆãŒ599ãƒ‰ãƒ«ï¼ˆ1ãƒ‰ãƒ«ï¼114å††æ›ç®—ã§ã€6ä¸‡8286å††ï¼‰ã§ã€è£½å“ã«çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã§å‡ºè·å¯èƒ½ãªProduction Moduleã¯1000å€‹ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆæ™‚ã§399ãƒ‰ãƒ«ï¼ˆåŒã€4ä¸‡5486å††ï¼‰ã€‚256 CUDAã‚³ã‚¢ï¼ˆGTX 1080 tiã§3584 cuda coresï¼‰ãªã®ã§ã€ã‚„ã¯ã‚Šå­¦ç¿’æ¸ˆã¿ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã®é‹ç”¨ãŒãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³ã¨æ€ã‚ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚

  • Qiita : NVIDIA Jetson TX2ã§TensorFlowã«ã‚ˆã‚‹äººä½“å§¿å‹¢æ¨å®šãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã‚’å‹•ã‹ã›ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚‹ã¾ã§

ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ã«é™ã‚‰ãšã€ãªã«ã‹ä½œã£ãŸã‚ˆã¨ã‹ã€ã“ã‚“ãªã®é¢ç™½ã„ã‚ˆã¨ã„ã†ã®ãŒã‚ã‚Œã°æ•™ãˆã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚æœ€è¿‘ãƒ©ã‚ºãƒ‘ã‚¤ã‚’æŒã¦ä½™ã—ã¦å›°ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

entry.title: Parameter Tuning
entry.content:
æ©Ÿæ¢°å­¦ç¿’ã‚’è¡Œã†éš›ã«å¤§äº‹ãªã®ãŒãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã®èª¿æ•´ã§ã™ã€‚ ä»Šã¾ã§é©å½“ã«ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆã®å€¤ã§ãã®ã¾ã¾ã‚„ã£ãŸã‚ŠGridearchã§æ¢ã—ãŸã‚Šã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã—ãŸãŒã€çµæ§‹æ™‚é–“ã‹ã‹ã‚‹ã®ã§ä»–ã®æœ‰åŠ¹ãªæ–¹æ³•ã‚’æ¢ã—ã¦ã€æ‰‹å…ƒã§å®Ÿéš›ã«å‹•ã‹ã—ã¦è¦‹ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã®è³‡æ–™ãŒã‚ã‹ã‚Šã‚„ã™ã‹ã£ãŸã§ã™ã€‚(å›³ã‚‚ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã®ã‚‚ã®ã‚’å¼•ç”¨ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ)

http://neupy.com/2016/12/17/hyperparameter_optimization_for_neural_networks.html

Bayesian Optimization

Bayesian Optimization ã¯ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã‚’\(\boldsymbol{x}\)ã€è©•ä¾¡å€¤(ç²¾åº¦ã¨ã‹)ã‚’\(y\)ã¨ã—ã¦

$$ y=f(\boldsymbol{x}) $$

ã¨ã„ã†é–¢æ•°ã‚’æŒ‡å®šã—ã¾ã™(ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹é–¢æ•°)ã€‚ä¸­èº«ã¯è‰¯ãã‚ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ãŒã€ã“ã®é–¢æ•°ã‚’æœ€é©åŒ–ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã‚’è¦‹ã¤ã‘ãŸã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ãã“ã§Baysian Optimizationã¯ã“ã®é–¢æ•°ãŒã‚¬ã‚¦ã‚¹éç¨‹ã«å¾“ã†ã¨ä»®å®šã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

ä¸‹ã®å›³ã§ã¯ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã®çµ„ã¿åˆã‚ã›ã‚’ãã‚Œãã‚Œ2,3å€‹ã¨ã£ã¦æ¥ã¦ã€ãã®è©•ä¾¡å€¤ã‚’è¨ˆç®—ã—ã¦çµæœã‚’ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆã—ãŸã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã§ã™ã€‚é’ã„æ›²ç·šã¯ã“ã®äºŒç‚¹ã‹ã‚‰å°ã‹ã‚Œã‚‹é–¢æ•°ã®äº‹å¾Œåˆ†å¸ƒã§ã€é’ã„éƒ¨åˆ†ã¯ã“ã®åˆ†å¸ƒã®95%ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã§ã™ã€‚

ã“ã®ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã¨ã€è¦³æ¸¬ç‚¹ã‹ã‚‰é›¢ã‚ŒãŸéƒ¨åˆ†ã¯ä¿¡é ¼åŒºé–“ã®å¹…ãŒåºƒã„(=\(\sigma\)ãŒå¤§ãã„)ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

ç²å¾—é–¢æ•°(Acquisition Function)

ç²å¾—é–¢æ•°ã¯ã€æ¬¡ã«ã©ã“ã®ç‚¹ã‚’è¦³æ¸¬ã™ã‚‹ã‹æ±ºã‚ã‚‹é–¢æ•°ã§ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã«ã¯ã„ã‚ã„ã‚ãªé–¢æ•°ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ãŒã€ã‚ˆãä½¿ã‚ã‚Œã‚‹ã®ãŒ

$$ g_\max (x)=\max(0,\ y_{\text{highest expected}}-y_{\max}) $$

ã¨ã„ã† Expected Improvement [Mockus,1978]ã§ã‚ã£ãŸã‚Šã€

$$ g_\max (x)=\mu(x)+\sigma(x) $$

ã®ã‚ˆã†ãª Mutual Information [Contal+2014]ãŒã‚ˆãä½¿ã‚ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚å¾Œè€…ã¯ç‰¹ã«ç›´æ„Ÿçš„ã«ã‚ã‹ã‚Šã‚„ã™ã„ã¨æ€ã†ã®ã§ã™ãŒã€ç§ãŸã¡ã‚‚æ¬¡ã«ã©ã®ç‚¹ã‚’é¸ã¶ã‹ã¨ã„ã†ã¨ãã«

  • è¦³æ¸¬ã—ãŸç‚¹ã‹ã‚‰æ¨æ¸¬ã—ã¦ç²¾åº¦ãŒè‰¯ã•ãã†ãªç‚¹ã‚’é¸ã³ãŸã„(\(\mu\)ãŒå¤§ãã„)
  • ã¾ã è¦³æ¸¬ã—ã¦ã„ãªã„å ´æ‰€ã‹ã‚‰é¸ã³ãŸã„( \(\sigma\) ãŒå¤§ãã„)

ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã‚’è€ƒãˆã¦é¸ã³ãã†ãªã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚ã‚ˆãã§ãã¦ã¾ã™ã­ã€‚

å®Ÿè£…

å®Ÿè£…ã«ã¯Bayesian Optimizationã‚’ä½¿ã„ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¯kaggleã®Otto Group Product Classification Challengeã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã§è©•ä¾¡æŒ‡æ¨™ã¯multi-class loglossã§ã™ã€‚å®šç•ªã®XGBoostã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’æœ€é©åŒ–ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚installã¯pipã§å…¥ã‚Šã¾ã™ï¼špip install bayesian-optimization

import pandas as pd
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from bayes_opt import BayesianOptimization

èª¿æ•´ã—ãŸã„ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã‚’å¼•æ•°ã«ã¨ã‚‹è©•ä¾¡é–¢æ•°ã®æŒ‡å®šã€ã‚¯ãƒ­ã‚¹ãƒãƒªãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã€‚bayesian-optimizationã«ã¯è©•ä¾¡é–¢æ•°ã®æœ€å¤§åŒ–ã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã—ã‹ãªã„ã®ã§ã€å°ã•ã„å€¤ã»ã©ã„ã„loglossã¯è¿”ã‚Šå€¤ã«-1ã‚’ã‹ã‘ã¾ã™ã€‚

def xgb_evaluate(min_child_weight, colsample_bytree,
                 max_depth, subsample, gamma, alpha):
    params['min_child_weight'] = int(min_child_weight)
    params['cosample_bytree'] = max(min(colsample_bytree, 1), 0)
    params['max_depth'] = int(max_depth)
    params['subsample'] = max(min(subsample, 1), 0)
    params['gamma'] = max(gamma, 0)
    params['alpha'] = max(alpha, 0)

    cv_result = xgb.cv(params, xgtrain, num_boost_round=num_rounds, nfold=5,
                       seed=random_state,
                       callbacks=[xgb.callback.early_stop(50)])

    return -cv_result['test-mlogloss-mean'].values[-1]

ã„ã‚ˆã„ã‚ˆæœ€é©åŒ–ï¼

if __name__ == '__main__':
    xgtrain = prepare_data()

    num_rounds = 3000
    random_state = 2016
    num_iter = 25
    init_points = 5
    params = {'eta': 0.1,
              'silent': 1,
              'eval_metric': 'mlogloss',
              'verbose_eval': True,
              'seed': random_state,
              'num_class':9}

    xgbBO = BayesianOptimization(xgb_evaluate,
                                 {'min_child_weight': (1, 20),
                                  'colsample_bytree': (0.1, 1),
                                  'max_depth': (5, 15),
                                  'subsample': (0.5, 1),
                                  'gamma': (0, 10),
                                  'alpha': (0, 10),})

    xgbBO.maximize(init_points=init_points, n_iter=num_iter)

çµæœ

ã ã„ãŸã„15å›ãã‚‰ã„ã®è©¦è¡Œã§loglossãŒ0.46136ã¾ã§ä¸‹ãŒã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã‚„ã£ã¦ã‹ã‚‰æ°—ã¥ã„ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ãŒã€max_depthã¨ã‹ã£ã¦æ•´æ•°ã®å€¤ã—ã‹ã¨ã‚‰ãªã„ã§ã™ã­ã€ã€ã€

ãŸã ã—ã€ãƒ™ã‚¤ã‚ºæœ€é©åŒ–ã«ã¯å¼±ç‚¹ã‚‚ã„ãã¤ã‹ã‚ã£ã¦ã€

  • ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªãƒ¼å¤‰æ•°ã®å ´åˆã«ã†ã¾ãã„ã‹ãªã„ã€‚
  • å¶ç„¶æ€§ã«å·¦å³ã•ã‚ŒãŸã‚Šã€å†ç¾æ€§ãŒå–ã‚Œãªã„ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚‹
  • ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãŒå¢—ãˆã¦ããŸã‚‰æ™‚é–“ã‹ã‹ã‚‹

ã¿ãŸã„ãªã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã§ã™ã€‚

Tree-structured Parzen Estimator(TPE)

ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå¼±ç‚¹ã‚’ä¿®æ­£ã—ãŸã®ãŒTPEã¨ã„ã†æœ€é©åŒ–æ‰‹æ³•ã§ã™ã€‚ãƒ™ã‚¤ã‚ºã¨ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚»ãƒ—ãƒˆã¯ä¼¼ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€æ‰‹æ³•ã¯å…¨ãç•°ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ä¸€èˆ¬çš„ãªæ–¹æ³•ã¨ã—ã¦ã€ã¾ãšRandom Searchã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦ã„ãã¤ã‹ç‚¹ã‚’ã¨ã£ã¦ãã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆã™ã‚‹ã¨ä¸‹ã®å›³ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

æ¬¡ã«ç²¾åº¦ãŒè‰¯ã‹ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®(å›³ã§ã¯ä¸Šä½20%)ã¨ãã†ã§ãªã‹ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®ã«åˆ†ã‘ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®2ç¾¤ã®å°¤åº¦é–¢æ•°ã‚’æ±‚ã‚ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚ã¾ã‚Šå°¤åº¦ã¨è¨€ã£ã¦ã‚‚é¦´æŸ“ã¿ã®ãªã„äººãŒå¤šã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¯æ§˜ã€…ãªç¢ºç‡åˆ†å¸ƒã®ã†ã¡ã€ã©ã®åˆ†å¸ƒã‹ã‚‰å¾—ã‚‰ã‚ŒãŸã‚‚ã®ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã®ãŒä¸€ç•ªå°¤ã‚‚ã‚‰ã—ã„ã‹ã‚’æ±ºã‚ã‚ˆã†ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Š2ç¾¤ã®ç¢ºç‡åˆ†å¸ƒãŒå‡ºæ¥ä¸ŠãŒã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

TPEã§ã‚‚Expected Improvementé–¢æ•°ã®ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«å®šç¾©ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ç²¾åº¦è‰¯ã‹ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®ã‚’\(l\),ãã†ã§ã¯ãªã‹ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®ã‚’\(g\)ã¨ã—ã¦ã€

$$ EI(x)=\frac{l(x)}{g(x)} $$

ã“ã‚Œã‚’ãã‚Œãã‚Œã®è¦³æ¸¬ç‚¹ã«å¯¾ã—ã¦é©ç”¨ã—ã€æœ€ã‚‚EIã®å€¤ãŒå¤§ãã‹ã£ãŸå ´æ‰€ãŒæ¬¡ã®è¦³æ¸¬ç‚¹ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

å®Ÿè£…

ã“ã£ã¡ã‚‚å®Ÿè£…ã—ã¦ã¿ã¾ã™ã€‚Pythonã§ã¯hyperoptã¨ã„ã†ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªãŒã‚ã£ã¦pipã§å…¥ã‚Šã¾ã™ï¼špip install hyperopt

import hyperopt
from hyperopt import hp, tpe, Trials, fmin

æœ€é©åŒ–ã™ã‚‹ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¯bayesian optimizationã¨åŒã˜ã‚„ã¤ã«ã—ã¦ã¿ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

hyperopt_parameters = {'min_child_weight': hp.uniform('min_child_weight',1,20),
                       'colsample_bytree': hp.uniform('colsample_bytree',0.1, 1),
                       'max_depth': hp.choice('max_depth',np.arange(5, 15)),
                       'subsample': hp.uniform('subsample',0.5, 1),
                       'gamma': hp.uniform('gamma',0, 10),
                       'alpha': hp.uniform('alpha',0, 10),}

æœ€é©åŒ–ã™ã‚‹é–¢æ•°ã®æŒ‡å®š

def objective(args):
    classifier = xgb.XGBClassifier(**args)
    stratifiedkfold = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=5)
    result = cross_val_score(classifier, train.drop(['id','target'],axis = 1), train.target, cv=stratifiedkfold,scoring='neg_log_loss')
    return -result.mean()

å®Ÿè¡Œï¼

max_evals = 50
trials = Trials() # å®Ÿè¡Œçµæœã‚’æ ¼ç´ã™ã‚‹ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹

best = fmin(objective,
            hyperopt_parameters,
            algo = tpe.suggest,
            max_evals =max_evals,
            trials = trials,
            verbose = 1)

çµæœ

loglossæœ€å°å€¤ã¯0.4749ã§ã—ãŸã€‚ã‚ã‚Œã€bayesian optimizaationã‚ˆã‚Šæ‚ªã„ã€ã€ã€bayesianã§ã¯max_depthã‚’æ•´æ•°ã«é™å®šã—ãªã‹ã£ãŸã‹ã‚‰ã‹ã‚‚ã€ã€ ã§ã‚‚è‡ªåˆ†ã§æ‰‹å‹•ã§ã‚„ã£ãŸæ™‚ã¯0.6ã¨ã‹ã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã€ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ‹ãƒ³ã‚°ã®æ™‚ã«ã¯ã“ã‚Œã‹ã‚‰ã“ã‚Œä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ã“ã†ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚ã¨ã“ã®xgboostå‹•ã‹ã™ã®ã«8ã‚³ã‚¢CPUä½¿ã£ã¦ãã‚Œãã‚ŒåŠæ—¥ãã‚‰ã„å›ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚GPUä½¿ã£ã¦ãŸã‚‰ã‚‚ã†ã¡ã‚‡ã„æ—©ã‹ã£ãŸã¨æ€ã†ã®ã§ã™ãŒã€ãã¡ã‚“ã¨buildã¨makeã—ã¦ã‚‚ã†ã¾ãã„ãã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚ã¾ãŸæŒ‘æˆ¦ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚
